Reviews.Content: Works just the way I wanted. Great for reading and opening documents. Fast Processor, runs smooth, quite thin, great Display.Cons I should of bought the 32 gb

Reviews.Title: Dear Jeff Bezos...
Reviews.Author: S. Bommarito
Reviews.Content: Dear Jeff,This evening when arriving home from work, I anxiously opened the packaging on my brand new Kindle Fire HDX 7".  After spending only a few moments, from setup to navigating through various apps (books, web, videos, etc...), I must say that the device is near flawless.  The unboxing and setup process were as effortless as anyone could hope for.  The performance is spectacular and allowed navigating around the various screens with lightening quickness.  The feel in my hands is wonderful, in terms of size, weight, shape, and texture.  Heck, I even tried out the Mayday button and I must confess it is probably the greatest customer service experience I have had in memory and probably ever.Finally, I come to the topic that has been discussed in so many prior reviews.  This display is beautiful, vibrant and precise.  Unfortunately, this perfection is inexcusably blemished by an uneven purple haze around its outer edges.  This haze is almost twice as wide along one length of the device compared to the opposite side and contrasts so much with the otherwise flawless display, that it provides a distraction I cannot live with.I literally fell in love with your "near masterpiece" in just minutes.  So much so that I mentally tried to convince myself that the many fine attributes outweighed this single flaw ("Gee, maybe I'll get used to it?"), but alas I realize that, like so many others, this is something that I cannot bring myself to "settle" with.I am returning your amazing invention with great regret and I hope that your talented team can resolve this unacceptable issue as quickly as possible.  When this happens, I promise I will be one of the very first to give it another try.  Until then, I would rather do without.Sincerely,A longtime (and hopefully valued) Amazon customer

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7"
Reviews.Author: bmc
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle to take on a family trip. We spent most of our Kindle time trying to get it to hold a charge. It continually had to be charged.  This problem persisted with the charger that came with the Kindle and with another that I'd ordered from Amazon.Insult to injury: in order to do the NYT crossword puzzle, one would need the vision of the gods.  AND the font could not be enlarged.I am very disappointed.  Very.BMC

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Susanlb "susanlb"
Reviews.Content: This is a huge disappointment.  There isvvrrVery disappointed in this purchase.  It is lighter than KFHD, but I really, so far, don't see that it was a wise purchase on my part.  My two requests for help showed me that these poor folks have had minimal training and weren't able to help.  The software is very glitchy with apps and magazines/newspapers.  Perhaps because it is new, no one has a clue how to fix things, except if you're willing to get through to Kindle technical support, and they can help by calling you on the phone.  You don't need to publish this, but I'd appreciate your sending my concerns up the line.  So far, I'd really like to return it.

Reviews.Title: fails to connect to wifi
Reviews.Author: Michael Hallock
Reviews.Content: Waiting on getting the third replacement kindle...this is ridiculous!!! Loved our first edition kindle fire but will NEVER buy another one..shame shame on Amazon...we bought 3 HDX Kindles for Christmas and have had more problems that I care to list....ipads here we come....

Reviews.Title: Would not purchase a Kindle HDX again!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: As a matter of full disclosure, I own a Kindle ereader paperwhite that works well. Next, I purchased a Kindle 7 inch HDX. CONSTANTLY HAS PROBLEMS CONNECTING WITH WIFI. None of the other devices on my network has this issue, therefore it is a problem with this tablet. Would not purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Depending on what you're looking for, this might be the perfect tablet for you.
Reviews.Author: Joshua LeClair
Reviews.Content: I'll start off with this right away so that you don't waste any more time than you need to. Officially you can't get any of the typical Google apps on this and while the Amazon App store is constantly growing, it still lacks some of the selection that the Google Play store has. If the Google apps (Gmail, Earth, Maps, Music, Youtube) are important to you, this is not the tablet for you.If you can get by without those apps (or are okay with using 3rd party email/youtube apps) and you will mainly be using this for content consumption (movies, books, music, web browsing) and happen to love the Amazon ecosystem, this is the tablet for you. Books look absolutely beautiful on the display as well as video content. Videos loading off of Amazon Prime loaded extremely fast and the ability to download videos from the Amazon Prime Video service for consumption offline is an amazing feature.Despite the slightly angled back this is rather easy to hold onto with one hand comfortably thanks to the smaller overall size (when compared to full size tablets) and it's light weight. The power and volume button being placed on the back is an odd design choice but one that you can get used to rather easily. Unfortunately the angled back also means that when the tablet is plugged in, the USB cable sticks out at a slight angle, may not be an issue but it does give me pause as it could lead to issues down the road.

Reviews.Title: wish I would have spent the extra money and got the Ipad mini
Reviews.Author: mary kay riley
Reviews.Content: The picture is good but find it harder to operate than my son's regular Ipad.  I had considered getting an ipad mini but thought this would meet my needs.  Unfortunately not easy to negotiate and too full of Amazon related products.  How can I get rid of Bing?  Seems like constant advertising.

Reviews.Title: Eventually this will be a great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've owned a Kindle Fire, Paperwhite, Keyboard, Fire HD and now 2 different HDX's.  The 2 HDX's are the only Kindle products I've ever had to return. This has the potential to be a great tablet once the bugs are worked out.  The bugs consist mainly of dropped wifi connections, the tablet showing a pop up message that you're not connected to a network when the notification icon shows fully connected, and completely "forgetting" wifi networks on a regular (almost daily) basis.  The first one was "buggy" out of the box, and I had to do 2 factory resets before it would even connect to a wifi network and allow me to register.  I tried factory resets numerous times on the first one and finally returned it.  I then purchased another one and it functioned out of the box, but the wifi issues started within 24 hours.  I did a couple of factory resets and the issues persisted along with random restarts.  After researching the issue online, it appears to be common.  I contacted customer service...who are always fantastic simply to ask if they planned a software or hardware "fix" for these issues.  They offered to exchange the tablet.  In my experience, Amazon is always very quick to fix any software issues...but not so much for hardware.  The solution always appears to be to stand behind the hardware and exchange it if justified.  I've had fantastic experiences with their customer service department.  But then again we buy the majority of our groceries, toiletries, household items and gifts from them...so it's obvious we're very loyal customers.  But in this case after having the same issue with 2 units purchased 3 weeks apart, I opted to simply return the HDX and wait for future "fixes" or for my HD to break beyond repair.  My Fire HD still works great, and I don't need to spend $250 on a table with "OK" improvements that is buggy,  I read and watch movies.  The screen on the HDX is bettter than the HD, but the speakers aren't quite as good.  It's certainly lighter and detaches from the cover easier, but the Origami cover isn't true to the original.  The original "origami" cover would allow you to position the Fire in at least 3 positions including a slanted keyboard setting...the new one only does vertical and horizontal.  We use the video out on the Kindle HD a lot while travelling so the kids can watch "safe" shows in hotels rather than risking the exposure to ^%&$ on hotel cable.  The HDX can employ a wireless device, but it has no mini HDMI out like the HD.  While the volume buttons on the HD were poorly positioned, at least you could reach them while holding the unit in it's case.  When using the Origami case with the HDX the buttons are covered.  So the HDX is faster, lighter, smaller, better screen, better UI, worse speakers, worse connectivity and buggy.  The HD is slightly heavier and larger, fantastic screen but not as good as the HDX.  But it's a 7" screen...I'm still trying to figure out why anyone needs that high of resolution on a 7" screen...but people want it on a 4.7" phone so...  The HD has better speakers and connectivity.  For those interested, the HD can also be "rooted" without losing the Kindle UI or access to Prime instant video features.  As of the time of this review, "rooting" HDX has presented issues for those that don't REALLY know what their doing.  Of course I would never recommend doing this either way since it voids the warranty, but at least there are ways to get that other "store" on the HD without losing all the great Amazon features.  I would have liked the 8.9 tablet, but I think it is way too expensive when you can pick up a Nook HD+ for about 1/3 of the price.  It has the "other" lay store and is easily adapted via the SD card slot to access the Amazon app store.  Of course there's a reason it's priced that low...talk about a "fire" sale!  :)

Reviews.Title: Software issues
Reviews.Author: Sarah Nickels
Reviews.Content: Bought 2 Kindle Fire HDX's as Christmas gifts for my 11yr old and 9yr old. One works great but the other had issues from the start. Kept randomly powering off (among other things)! And now it won't turn on even after troubleshooting. Very Frustrating when you've had it for less than 2 weeks. Spoke to an Amazon Customer Care Rep and they said it's a software issue. Said that they'll send out a new one. Overall we liked the Kindle Fire (when it worked) and Amazon did do a good job at resolving my issue promptly with little hassle.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely WONDERFUL
Reviews.Author: Faith J. Hinkey
Reviews.Content: I'm so happy to have this tablet. I have wanted one for quite a while but was unsure which tablet would be the right one for me. After checking them out on the web I saw this one and decided it would be the one to meet my needs and desires. My husband wanted me to have it for a Christmas present. It exceeds my expectations. So glad I chose this tablet!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have used the Ipad 1,2,3,4,and air and of all the tablets I have used this by far has the best resolution. It's fast and the battery last very  long.

Reviews.Title: Another must have eReader for my collection
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I really like the text-to-speech function.  It has much improved from the very robotic voice on my Kindle Keyboard.  Though not as good as an audible performance, it is great when the eyes are tired or if I need a little help concentrating on the story.  This has replaced my new Paperwhite 2 as my preferred reader.The Prime video streaming is also very good.  Maybe it is the smaller size, but streaming "Duck Dynasty" from Amazon Prime was much clearer and sharper than steaming Netflix on my iPad air.  The subtitles were also available on Amazon and not on Netflix on this particular show.  I haven't compared other videos yet.My only complaint is the blue light bleed when reading a book.  My white pages have a blue edge with one side almost bleeding into the text.  It was a little annoying at first, but the quality text-to-speech makes up for it.  I guess for me, it means if the next 7" HDX uses white instead of blue LED's I'll have to get it as I really love this small lightweight form and the elimination of the blue edge would make it perfect.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied!
Reviews.Author: vinry "yaa"
Reviews.Content: I love this Kindle Fire HDX 7". I was originally thinking about purchasing the newly released iPad mini Retina display for its smaller screen size, having previously owned the original iPad, then iPad 2 (as well as BlackBerry PlayBook). But then one day I received a 30-day free trial offer for a Kindle Fire HDX from Amazon, and I said to myself "why not" and opted for the 8.9-inch version with the thought that I would just play with it for a couple of weeks and then return it and buy the iPad mini, never suspecting that I would fall in love with the graphics, sound, and ease of use of a Kindle Fire HDX. I still returned the free-trial 8.9-inch one but decided to purchase the 7-inch version, because the former was still a bit too large for my need (recall I have the bigger iPad and iPad2).The 8.9-inch version of this Kindle (the one that I free-tried) doesn't have the bluish borders, the 7-inch version does. I read about this issue while waiting for the delivery my 7-inch version while still using the 8.9-inch version and became concerned. But guess what, it turns out that the borders do not bother me at all. No big deal! I can read each of my e-books just fine. It actually reminds me of the old novels I have whose pages have turned yellowish on the edges.I have a couple of large wide-screen TVs at home but found myself lately watching movies more often on my Kindle Fire HDX. it just shows how good the display of this little device is.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Tessa
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HD X. I love this it is the nicest picture I have seen on any device other than my  HD tv. I lov ewatching TV on this and  browsing. This is the nicest tablet I have ever had! The price is great! I am so glad I chose this. Great Christmas present for anyone out there !

Reviews.Title: In Love
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: It is easy to use and if I don't understand something I just hit the "may day" button. I have an Ipad and I haven't picked it up since I received my Kindle. I am in LOVE with my Kindle.

Reviews.Title: great tablet for school and for fun
Reviews.Author: mitch
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best tablet you could get for your money. From not even considering this tablet in the beginning of my tablet hunt, to owning it now, I am so glad I bought it. I originally was looking for a tablet for school, so.I was looking more at Windows tablets. There's a lot of nice Windows tablets out there, but anything in my price range (200-400) had problems, if it was a high res screen and crappy processor, or a speedy prossesor and a cruddy screen resolution, or even if the item was out of stock or a bad operating system, I had never considered the kindle fire HDX. This runs a 2.2 gigahertz processor about .4-1 gigahertz faster than any Windows tablets I had considered, even the galaxy tablets I was thinking about only had 1.6 gigahertz processors. Galaxy tablets and galaxy notes have maybe 2 things that beat this tablet: the infrared capability and the multitasking capability. Nothing else. The  os on the kindle is just as good, the screen res is 1080 compared.to there 720, camera isn't as good on the kindle but I wasn't concerned about this as I have a nice camera on my phone,and  the processor on the kindle blows the galaxy tablets out of the water! The kindle has just as good productivity capability as the galaxy tablets, because if you buy a stylus and download a note taking app, you have the main selling point of the galaxy note! I think this tablet should be something for everyone to consider

Reviews.Title: Great for price-minded parents
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this out of curiosity as I already own an iPad. I bought it mainly as a device for my child (although it is still "mine"). I appreciate the kid options: the timers and parental controls for the internet access. This is a must for me. I especially like that it will grow with her (unlike the Leap Pad I got her 2 years ago).I was surprised that I like the size. It's still a good sized screen with great graphics and color.I think this is a good alternative for price-minded  parents and Amazon Prime fans.

Reviews.Title: Love my new kindle
Reviews.Author: Giselle
Reviews.Content: i love my new kindle. the best feature is the mayday feature is the best. You can instantly get live help if you are new to kindle and don't know how to use it.  AMazon has the BEST customer service i have ever come accross.  I couldn't decide between and ipad mini or a kindle Fire HDX and I am very glad i chose the kindle.

Reviews.Title: In love
Reviews.Author: Reader
Reviews.Content: I had some hesitation about buying this device after reading some of the negative reviews - and the fact that that I was an early buyer of the original Kindle Fire two years ago, which was, to put it mildly, a piece of crap.  I also am a longtime iPad user (and lover) but the iPad is a little hard to hold in one hand when I'm reading in bed.  So I had high hopes that the HDX would fit the bill as a nice, lighter-weight 7-inch device with iPad-like qualities.  I have to say, it really surpassed my expectations!  The display is gorgeous and the Silk browser is about a million light-years away from the original Fire.  The size and weight are perfect (don't underestimate the importance of the lighter weight if you're considering an iPad).  I've had no issues whatsoever with a flickering screen, WiFi connectivity etc that other users mentioned...my experience has been fantastic.As an Apple aficionado, I would still give my iPad a slight edge over the Fire, but only because of the availability of apps and the seamless syncing of all my stuff through iTunes with my iPhone and my Mac desktop.  But aside from those things I actually prefer the HDX purely as a device - the light weight and portability combined with the performance are all amazing.  And at this price point (I actually got the $50 off deal, for $179), it's a no brainer.  Buy it!

Reviews.Title: Best tablet for the money
Reviews.Author: lrc3395
Reviews.Content: I purchased the kindle fire HDX to replace an Acer tablet I got last year. Prior to the Acer I had owned a first generation Kindle Fire and a first Generation iPad. The Acer had a four core processor, like the Kindle Fire HDX, was HD, and had a 10.1" screen. The HDX beats the more expensive Acer hands down in every way. The screen is beautiful, with awesome color and clarity, the processor is fast, and the battery life is very good. The sound from the stereo speakers is better than any of the previous tablets I've had, with great separation. The smaller size took a bit to get used to, although I've found I like the portability and light weight of the smaller device.Amazon's operating system works well, and is fairly intuitive, although I had trouble getting some apps to show me the "home" button a few times and I sometimes wish it had a physical sleep button. The "special offers" feature that keeps the price low is very unobtrusive and hasn't bothered me at all. It's definitely not worth the extra expense to upgrade to the version without special offers.I use Amazon products constantly: frequent purchases from their website, the app store, kindle books, Audible, music, and videos. The Kindle Fire HDX seamlessly merges all of those into a convenient package. This is definitely the best tablet available for the money, hands down.

Reviews.Title: Why haven't you gotten one yet??
Reviews.Author: Patricia M. Dashiell
Reviews.Content: I actually have the iPad Mini Retina and this Kindle Fire blows the mini Retina out of the water as far as clarity.  Honestly, I use the mini for all the apps I used to have on my old iPod touch. If you are a Prime member or a streamer, I believe the Kindle Fire is a must.

Reviews.Title: tablet is full of surprises.
Reviews.Author: nathan
Reviews.Content: This tablet is pretty amazing. The size is comfortable enough to hold, type, and surf the internet. The picture quality of the screen is better then my hd tv seems to be. The audio of this tablet though took me by surprise for the speakers being in the back of the tablet the sound quality is absolutely amazing. Sounds like surround sound even. The only reason I didn't give five stars is the fact that a lot of Google apps are not available on this tablet. I use Google chrome as my browser on everything but cannot on here kinda sucks. Hope one day Google and Amazon will join together to share apps.

Reviews.Title: Love My Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: This came as a gift to upgrade me from the third generation Kindle and the Kindle app on my smartphone. When given the choice between this and the Paperwhite, I chose this one due to the ability to use as a regular tablet when I'm not reading.Pros:- The picture is absolutely stunning, especially when watching tv/movies. The picture is vibrant, clear, and sharp.- It's faster than I thought it would be, including powering up and down. Much better than the third gen Kindles.- I'm able to play games like Candy Crush Saga and Wheel of Fortune without any issues.- Can access Netflix, Hulu +, and other tv apps!Cons:-The battery doesn't last as long as I had hoped when playing games but it's still better than playing them on my tiny smartphone.- The weight of the Kindle, while lighter than previous generations can feel heavy after using it for a while. This isn't a huge "con" since there are those tablet pillows I can buy to alleviate the need for me to hold it while I watch shows or read.- Every now and then, especially when the brightness is turned all the way up, the screen vibrates which can cause dizziness. It only lasts for a moment at a time but it can get annoying when it does it more than once an hour. When I have the screen dimmed it doesn't appear to have that vibration problem.Overall, this is a fabulous buy, especially for those of us who were able to get a holiday deal on it. Even full price, it's worth it. The Nook was looking good simply because it has access to Google Play and Chrome whereas the Kindle only uses their own proprietary shop (Amazon App Store). But after reading reviews from experts and consumers it seems the Kindle is still the better tablet. Besides, the way Barnes and Noble is heading, they may not be around long enough to support the new Nooks into the future. At least Amazon seems strong and doesn't appear to be going anywhere anytime soon so the Kindle will be supported for years to come.I highly recommend this for anyone older than 10 years old. Even with the parent controls on the Kindle, I would still choose Nabi and Nabi, Jr for kids under the age of 10.

Reviews.Title: For the Novice in all of us...or the non-technigeeks  :)
Reviews.Author: K. Johanson
Reviews.Content: It's not always about saving money, even though the HDX is very, very competitively priced.  Sure, the Kindle family is geared to take advantage of the Amazon media content, but this tablet can do so much more.If you want to search the internet, hit your favorite web sites, or simply cruise web links or other hits, the HDX performs exceptionally well as long as you have an adequate internet connection.  The HDX is perfect for streaming movies and music whether it's Amazon content, or non-Amazon content such as Pandora, Netfilx, or other Kindle and/or Android aps.  The 7" is perfect for my travel needs--it's light enough to hold in one hand, the battery will easily last one day with very heavy use, and it's easy on the eyes as the screen/display is excellent.If you want portability and your needs are primarily email functions, browsing the internet, streaming media, using aps & playing games the HDX is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: Kindle's rock, and this one is even better than the last!
Reviews.Author: MM
Reviews.Content: We love our Kindles more than our iPads! The typing is better, the internet is easier to use, and the selection and store is way better. We do use iPads for games, but we might not keep following Apple. It's so much nicer to have an Android platform for multi-tasking apps, etc.

Reviews.Title: Great gift for my mom
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: This is my first Kindle (so I don't have others to compare it to) but I love it. It is actually a gift for my mom but I had to set it up for her so I actually got to use it for awhile. It is very user friendly and easy to use. I wish you could "jazz" it up a little by changing the background picture or colors on it but you can't. My mom just uses it for games, internet, videos, but hasn't got into any books just yet. Amazon Prime account is a must with this I would think.

Reviews.Title: Runs very fast, great package!
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Pretty slick little system. I'm not in love with the design. The back is not flat, part of it sticks out in a weird pattern but this is way faster than even my Kindle Fire. Having some problems with my Wi-Fi staying connected 1 but my wife's works great. Probably isolated issue. I'd say this is an iPad killer for sure.

Reviews.Title: Patient and Gentle
Reviews.Author: Edith C McDaniel
Reviews.Content: Because they were so helpful and patient with explaining things to me.  I am a senior citizen and I felt like they respected that.

Reviews.Title: In Love with HDX
Reviews.Author: J. Allen
Reviews.Content: As everyone in my family reads we started with just the Kindle Paperwhite.  My girls still use theirs to read daily.  Last year I upgraded to the Kindle Fire and fell in love, was very rarely seen without my Fire.  When my husband decided that he wanted a Fire we debated what we were going to do and decided that I would upgrade and he would take my old Fire.  I bought the HDX from Best Buy and so far I am thrilled with it.  I have not noticed the purple/blue light at the edge that some people have mentioned and find the clarity on the screen to be stunning.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone...Buy and enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7" is an exceptional device.
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Cowen
Reviews.Content: This device is amazing and you will be happy you bought it. The Kindle Fire is an amazing device that displays images like as if they were lifelike.  The device features a fast 2.2GHz quad-core processor and 2GB of RAM for fast that run apps, games, and videos smoothly without an issues.  You will love this device and you can get free two day shipping with this offer.  So if you are in the market for a tablet you like this Kindle.  The marketplace from Amazon is great too.  There are thousands of books and games for free available to you.The thing that separates Amazon's Kindle devices is the fact that their customer service is world class. So many companies get this aspect of their businesses wrong but not Amazon. I had a Kindle device that died on me and they replaced it no questions asked. I have also had to call them occasionally and believe it or not I actually talked to a person, no recorded message. Amazon gets it when it come to their customer service.You will not regret getting this device.Thank you for reading my review, if you have any questions feel free to email me, I would be happy to help you with any questions you have.

Reviews.Title: Love My First Tablet
Reviews.Author: Tamara
Reviews.Content: Love it. My first experience with tablet. Owned for less than a month therefore still have not checked out all of the loaded applications, books or movies available on this device, have spent much of my time enjoying card and bingo games. I like being able to sync email and use the internet but still need to learn more about how to navigate typing on the keyboard. My laptop is now gathering dust! Yes I have recommended the Kindle Fire HDX to others.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hdx 7"
Reviews.Author: Tammy Shaffer
Reviews.Content: Everything I was looking for in a tablet, Blue light is very visible on one side! Occasionally shuts off when I am in the middle of something. Fast, very fast. Great for movies, audio books, music, and apps galore. They didn't joke when they set this baby up for the internet. My computer can only wish!  Have origami case, works well, no issues.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Runner
Reviews.Content: Bought this for the wife as a replacement for her old Kindle. She absolutely loves it. She doesn't need to use her laptop much anymore. It looks great too.

Reviews.Title: For simply an entertainment device this is fantastic
Reviews.Author: T. Smith
Reviews.Content: I ended up returning but if you're looking for simply an entertainment device this is fantastic.  And the sound!  Just awesome!But I couldn't live without access to the Google Play store and the lack of a physical home button was a bit of a nuisance.  I kept hitting the virtual button during normal typing... changed it for a Nook HD+, which was a fantastic bargain for only $139 at the time.

Reviews.Title: Fire 7HDX
Reviews.Author: R. welsh
Reviews.Content: I have an iPad 2 and really don't like it for reading. Basically, it's a big iPhone. Good product but it is to big to lie in bed and read. Wife has a Fire original and likes it well enough. I decided to try the new Fire 7HDX. Received it and for a few days tried to come up with a reason why I should not like it and send it back and order an iPad mini2. Well I have to tell ya that this little device is as good as Amazon says! Sister in law has a Fire7HD and loves it. Comparing her Fire7HD with the 7HDX there's not much difference between the two. I have found the 7HDX more comfortable to cradle in the hand for reading in bed. Nice device. Purchased Poetic cover for it(read review) and will keep.

Reviews.Title: As great as the ads said it would be!
Reviews.Author: Jean B. Holzer
Reviews.Content: Screen beautifully sharp, easy and intuitive to use, light-weight enough to hold comfortably for extended reading. On the light side, as a knitter I plan to make my own case for it, and a friend commented, "You must love it if you're going to make it a sweater!"

Reviews.Title: Save your money and purchase Google/Android. Not enough for the price.
Reviews.Author: Breanna Penque
Reviews.Content: I can relate to every consumer who has looked at these reviews and questioned if the Kindle Fire HDX was a good choice for a gift (or possibly for yourself). For starters, the blue "glare" that is mentioned around the edge of the screen is there. I don't think its so horrible that you won't be able to read on the white screen. You can also change the text background in your books for example. you can read on a black background with white letters and the blue glare goes away. However, I received my kindle today and its already being shipped back. I don't think its a great buy for the price, yes the specs are great however the new Google nexus tablet is the same price for 32gb a frontal and back camera along with HD viewing capabilities. Further every tablet can download the kindle app or some type of e-reader app for books. The kindle tablet has limited access to the app market where android and apple are almost pretty equal. Amazon talks up a great game with this tablet, but I don't think it owns up to the price. Lastly I bought this to use almost as a portable laptop because I read you can VIEW Microsoft office documents. I first mis-read this for using Microsoft office. The kindle does not offer such a feature you can only simply view these things. Google you can't exactly use Microsoft office but does have word processing capabilities for all of us "on-the-go" and who can't afford the beautiful new window tablets. Hope this helps everyone on the fence!

Reviews.Title: Nice!!!
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This is a Kindle, not an iPad. That said, the quality and value afforded by this product is top knotch! I previously owned a first generation Kindle and resisted buying the HD when it came out. I really REALLY liked my old Kindle but now that I have my 7" HDX I have to admit there is no comparison. The display? Awesome! The redesigned and repositioned controls? Awesome! The speakers? Wow! So how does it work? Flawlessly so far and much smoother than the original Kindle. The wifi is so much better. The browser is so much better. I love this new HDX 7". I have no regret buying it so far. It is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Much to like; trying to get used to the glowing blue border
Reviews.Author: TwoTooth
Reviews.Content: There is now a note on the HDX product page about the glowing blue border. I believe this note is a recent addition, but it would've been easy to miss earlier. It's close to the top of the page and is under the heading We want you to know, followed by Learn more about design decisions to help make an informed purchase. This links to the following statement: "We want you to know...The Kindle Fire HDX 7" has perfect color accuracy (100% sRGB), and we wanted to share more details around our display design decisions that helped us achieve this.You may notice a very narrow, faint blue tint around the edge of the device when looking at items with a white background, such as books or web pages. All displays have some level of light emission around the edges, and the light on the Kindle Fire HDX 7" is blue due to the technology used to render perfect color accuracy. Most LCD displays use white LEDs, and then apply filters to extract the desired color. The result is oftentimes a compromise to tone and color accuracy, or--if attempting to address these compromises--an increase in battery consumption and, thus, device weight.We've taken a different approach. To achieve the perfect color accuracy on Kindle Fire HDX 7" at the lowest possible battery consumption and device weight, we used blue, not white, LEDs. Blue LEDs allow for a much more accurate and rich representation of color and result in an up to 20% improvement in power efficiency."So amazon's official stance is that the glowing blue border results from deliberate design decisions and is therefore not a manufacturing defect. We'll all have to decide for ourselves whether this is true and that all subsequent HDXs will have the same effect.I'm giving this three stars because I think amazon should've warned people about the blue border in advance. I do otherwise like the HDX in comparison to my first gen Fire and would give it four stars. I'm going to spend the next couple of weeks deciding whether I'll become accustomed enough to the blue border to no longer notice it (this is already happening to some extent).

Reviews.Title: Cannot borrow audible books from your public library with this kindle. Shame on kindle.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Amazon continues to attempt to make sure you have to buy audible books through their audible store by failing to write the code in this new kindle that would make it compatible with oneclick digital which is the app the public library system uses to provide audible books for free (lends them just like a library book).Now they could include in their description that the app will not work with this particular kindle version but than people might not buy the tablet.  After an hour of being shuffled, disconnected and otherwisw aggravated with "customer service" I was told that the app writers would have to change their app to make it compatible.  Unlike most free apps that run constant ads the one click digital app is provided by our public library who can ill afford to make those software changes each time kindle develops a new version of its tablet.  Since we know previous kindles have had the software written to make them compatible we also must logically conclude that they could continue to do so.  It does not take a genius to figure out why  the new hdx was made incompatible.  Shame on you for effectively eliminating many peoples ability to obtain audible content.  As there are many children's books available to lend out this is particularly disgusting.  As a parent would I prefer my kids listen to someome reading a good book or playing games or movies with zero educational benefit?  I wish I hadn't traded in my old kindle which did have the software to work with the app.As I could not return this until Monday I decided to try the tablets other features.  The charging cord and plug that came with the device occasionally says it is the incorrect device to charge rapidly.The picture is nice but the 7 inch is so little that watching movies is not pleasant on the eyes, it gave me a headache holding the device close enough to see.The tablet frequently could not access the internet even though it showed I was connected in the settings.I guess they have to put out a new version yearly but truely unless there is significant technical improvement they should wait.

Reviews.Title: Great performance and value
Reviews.Author: FreeSpirit
Reviews.Content: QUICK SUMMARY - So far I think the Kindle Fire HDX is a great device given its performance, price point, and some really nice features though it is missing some features that would have been nice to have.1. FORM FACTOR - Compared to both the original Kindle Fire and the Fire HD, the HDX is lighter and thinner. Edges on the back are curved though not fully rounded, they still make it easy to grip the device. I can comfortably hold it in portrait mode in one hand between my thumb and palm and type with the other hand. The size and light weight makes it comfortable for one-handed reading for longer periods of time. There is a power button and volume +/- buttons on the back. The buttons are as easily accessible in landscape mode, but I'm still getting used to using them in portrait mode.2. SCREEN - This screen is the best in terms of resolution I have seen so far, sharper than its predecessors. There is no blurring of images or text under bright or dark background screens. Try pinch-zooming on an image, you will see that the integrity of the picture holds up pretty well despite zooming in real close. Reading e-books on this screen is easier on the eyes than reading on an iPad. I personally prefer to use my old e-ink Kindle to read books, but when traveling I plan to use the HDX. It doesn't strain the eyes as much as most other tablet screens that I have seen.3. SPEAKERS - I briefly compared speakers of the HD and HDX by playing the same song and maximizing the volume on both. The Fire HD's speakers were definitely louder when cranked up, but the difference was not significant. The speakers on the HDX however have better sound quality compared to the Mini for sure. That said, I personally don't buy tablets for their surround sound. I mostly use a tablet either with headphones or connected to a TV.4. STORAGE - I bought the 16GB version and I am already thinking I should probably upgrade to the 32GB. Of the 16GB, there is perhaps approximately 11-12GB available for end use, just an estimate - I could be off on this. This leaves little space if I want to store my entire music and video collection on the device, along with pictures and apps. For an extra $40, the 32GB is looking like a pretty good option. That being said, if you have most or all your collection stored on Amazon's Cloud Drive which you can stream to the HDX, the 16GB should be good.5. SPEED - The HDX is noticeably faster than the original Fire, and also feels improved over the Fire HD. Apps and videos load quicker. The most noticeable difference in speed is when browsing. Browsing on the Silk platform is smoother and less choppy. The difference is more evident when you go back from the HDX to browsing on an earlier generation Fire or another device.6. BATTERY - The HDX came with a micro-USB power charger! Advertised battery charging time is under 6 hours. Once fully charged, run time is said to be approximately 11 hours. Plenty for an average user like me, I use it probably 2-3 hours at most on any given day. This is supposed to have better battery life compared to that of its predecessor.7. CAMERA - The HDX 7" version comes with a front facing camera only for Skype or other video calls. I tried the front camera briefly, picture quality seemed good for Skype calls. The 8.9" however, comes with both a front and rear camera. I myself don't really use tablets to take pictures, I have my phone for that, but if you would really like to take pictures with this device, the 8.9" would be the way to go.8. WITH OR WITHOUT SPECIAL OFFERS - I have always bought the Fires with special offers to save $15. Figured I always had the option of paying this amount later and removing the ads if they annoyed me. However, the ads appear only on the lock screen, which I don't look at any way, so it doesn't bother me at all. If ads on the lock screen annoy you or if you want a more personalized lock screen, you can simply pay the extra $15 and it goes away.SOME REALLY NICE FEATURES:The following features, in my opinion, are a game changer in favor of the Kindle Fire HDX:1. MAYDAY - A one-button tap gets you online with a live support agent within an advertised 15 seconds (swipe down on the time on top of the screen, MayDay button appears as one of the options). You can see the agent, but the agent can only hear you (though I think the agent should be able to see you if you fired up the front camera, but that's only if you want the agent to see you). The agent can take control of the device and help with any questions you may have. I tried this service once, connected in 15-20 seconds, agent walked me through trying to stream video through Apple TV (wasn't compatible). Audio and video quality was good, but I just found it weird looking at someone while getting support. Maybe it'll take getting used to, I guess I'm just so used to getting support over the phone.As of now, I'm not sure if the MayDay service is provided for the life of the device, or for the warranty period only, or if there's a charge for the service once the warranty expires. If someone familiar with this can post a comment, that would be very much appreciated.2. OFFLINE PRIME CONTENT - This is another really cool feature that has been added. Prime videos can be downloaded to the device for offline viewing - extremely useful for travelers when you don't have wireless coverage or wi-fi available! However, note that not all movies or shows can be downloaded - there are titles that are available only for online viewing. I guess this probably has to do with the studios and what titles they have agreed to make downloadable. Nevertheless, as long as I can download 4-6 hours of content for a flight, that is all I need! Once I return from a trip, I can simply delete the movies and download new ones. With this feature, a lower storage capacity device becomes more viable because I don't need to keep downloaded movies on it at all times. I can delete and add as I wish. This feature also helps save on wireless minutes. You can download a movie at home over Wi-Fi and play it on the road without spending 3G minutes to stream.3. SECOND SCREEN - This feature is expected to be available soon so I haven't had a chance to try it yet. With Second Screen, the Kindle screen can be mirrored on to your TV. From the description, it appears that the HDX does more than just mirroring - you can stream a movie to your TV and then use the HDX to check emails, browse the web, etc - basically you are free to use your tablet for anything while it is streaming to your TV. If this is true, this is a major step ahead of what most other tablets are capable of doing in this regard. With my iPad, I can only mirror the screen but I can't use it for anything else while it is streaming to my TV. I am excited to try out this new feature, will post an update once this feature is made available.Note - In order to stream to your TV, you will need a Smart TV or a compatible device like PS 3/4. If you don't have a TV or device that can connect wirelessly, you will need a Miracast dongle that plugs into your TV's HDMI port and can be set up on your wireless network to communicate with the HDX. I bought a dongle like this for around $100 a few years ago, but I think you can now find them here on Amazon for $40-50 (you can search for "Miracast dongle"). It is possible some devices are unable to connect because of their software or other compatibility issues. So for devices like say the Apple TV or Google Chromecast, if they are incompatible right off the bat, you can search online for apps that make them compatible with the HDX.4. FREETIME - This is a neat feature for families with kids, both in terms of time and content management. (i) Time - We have two boys and we try to keep tablet time in check (one hour each day Fri-Sun). Sometimes it's difficult to get them to let go when their time is up, and the ensuing battle never ends! With this feature, we have the option to set a time limit so the kids know automatically when their time is up. We also have the option of leaving a category like reading without a time limit. (ii) Content - We can basically create a sub-profile within the HDX and choose what content we want to be available in there. This is like creating a tablet within a tablet in some ways. Within the sub-profile, we can choose what games, apps, videos they can watch, and also change the backdrop to make it look like a kid's tablet. Very thoughtfully executed design.CONs:1. NO HDMI - The HDX no longer has the Micro HDMI port that last year's Fire HD came with. I thought this was a great feature to connect the device to TVs particularly when traveling. This also made it easier to connect the device to audio receivers to blast music through external speakers. With HDMI gone, you simply have to rely on wi-fi to connect to a TV. Most hotels are not equipped with smart TVs in rooms yet. So if you absolutely want to use the HDX to watch videos on your hotel room TV, you will need to carry the Miracast dongle as well. If the lack of HDMI is a deal breaker for you, I think last year's Fire HD might be the way to go.2. NO EXPANDABLE STORAGE - It would have been helpful if the HDX came with a memory card slot that could be used to play movies or content from an external storage device. This would leave the HDX storage itself open for apps and other content that must be stored on the tablet to be used. Also, expandable storage would mean that the 16GB version of the device would be good enough. However, if you have most content on Amazon's Cloud or have purchased volumes of movies/music from Amazon, lack of this feature shouldn't be an issue for you.3. NO GOOGLE PLAY APPS - Even though it runs on an Android platform, the HDX doesn't have access to Google Play which means the selection of apps available on the HDX is limited. That being said, it is fairly simple to install apps that are not otherwise available within the Amazon app store. You can run a Google search on "how to add external apps (or Google Play apps) on Kindle Fire." It's pretty straightforward. I have found that the downloaded apps work great. Just remember to NOT root the Fire when installing these apps.4. 7" HDX LACKS REAR CAMERA - The 7" comes with only a front facing camera for video calls, it doesn't have a rear-facing camera. I personally don't need a rear camera on my tablet, but if you definitely need one, you can go for the 8.9" which has both a front and rear facing camera.ACCESSORIES:1. CASE - I bought two cases with the device - the Amazon Origami case and the Marware Origin case. Origami - more stylish, functional, various stand positions, excellent quality, $50. Marware - inexpensive at $20, stand, basic frugal choice.2. SCREEN PROTECTOR - The Kindle screen is pretty good against scratches, but I have put a screen protector on regardless. I got the Marware screen protector - good quality and keeps the screen clear like there's nothing there.3. MIRACAST DONGLE - There are several adapters you can find here on Amazon. You will need this for streaming to your TV if you don't have a Smart TV or a compatible wireless device like PS3/4.4. CHARGERS - If you need to purchase additional chargers or cables, regular Micro-USB chargers/cables will work fine.BOTTOM LINE - Compared to the previous Kindle Fire versions and other tablets that I have used, the HDX is lighter, faster, has an excellent screen, and is loaded with some amazing features. All this for $229 makes the device a great choice. Whether or not to buy the HDX is entirely a personal decision. In my humble opinion, the choices:(i) If you have a recent tablet like say the Fire HD and are contemplating an upgrade, the upgrade may be worthwhile if you absolutely must have some of the new features (like Second Screen or offline Prime content).(ii) If the new features are not that meaningful for your purposes, it may be better to stay with your current device and wait for the next round of device releases.(iii) If this is the first tablet you are considering, scroll to the top and add to cart.

Reviews.Title: Not a secure device
Reviews.Author: Sclark
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Kindle Fire HDX, based on all of the favorable reviews.  My only complaint is that the device is not secure, right out of the box.  While the Kindle may be great at what it is intended to do, I pretty much rejected it due to a lack of security and regard to my Amazon account.  I am writing this review as a word of caution to others who may order it:When you order the Kindle, Amazon will ask you if you want to pre-register it.  They are doing this as there were many complaints of registrations failing after customers received the device, so they pre-register it for you before shipping, to cut down the amount of calls to their support.  The bad part of this is that, straight out of the box, you can click on "Shop Amazon" and go straight into your account.  The app, or the Kindle itself, does not ask for your credentials.  What this means is that my Kindle could have been mis-delivered, someone could have opened the box, powered on the Kindle, and had immediate access to my Amazon account (settings, Order History....everything).  I was even able to go shopping and could have made purchases, all without being prompted for my account credentials.Even with a passcode lock on the device, once registered and accessed, the Kindle prompts you no further for your Amazon credentials.  For some folks this might be OK, but for others who loan their Kindle to their kids, friends, or are just plain security conscious, this may be an issue for them.  It would be nice to see Amazon step up security and regard for customer's privacy on their portable devices.

Reviews.Title: Piece of crap
Reviews.Author: anaconda
Reviews.Content: I thought I was gonna like this... I had this for a week and I noticed the screen flicker that haunts this device... Switching between screens and on some games the screen brightness will flicker for 2 to 5secs I talked to mayday and chat and they had me do a factory reset and it still did it.... 3 device replacements later and still the flicker.. My gfs kindle does it to, also also each device I had the color tone of the screen was different at the same brightness... Plus u can side load apps but they won't always show up on the home screen and some will stop working and u will have to unintstall them, u will have to stick with the amazon App Store which sucks... Nothing updates fast ...  I urge u to consider the nexus 7 instead and just download the kindle app if that's what your into, of do what I did and just lay down the extra cash and get the iPad mini with retina....  The only pro with the hdx is the device is fast but other that that it's not worth your time

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Chrisie Ward
Reviews.Content: I have been a Kindle owner for many years. Bought the Kindle DX, then upgraded to the Kindle HD last year and purchased Amazon prime for the Prime streaming of TV and movies. So when they announced the new HDX would allow for downloading prime movies and TV shows I thought it would be fantastic. I use the Kindle for reading alot and also for watching the movies and TV episodes while exercising. So I thought with the new HDX and being able to download the prime TV/movies, it would be perfect for those hotels which have very poor wifi in the fitness room and I could also watch movies/TV on the plane.Well, watching the movies and TV shows are much better than the HD, but it comes at a cost, and to me it's a big cost. The reading experience on the new HDX is terrible. The blue/purple line is definitely noticeable, not only when reading but also on anything with a white background, including email and web pages. This is not actually a major problem for me but I can see how some people would find it distracting. My major issue with the HDX is the color of the backgrounds while reading. As noted in some previous reviews, the black background is not black, it's grey but my biggest problem is the white background. It's not white, it's off white/light yellow. When comparing to an iPhone/iPad and even the previous HD, it definitely has a yellow tint. The fact that it's a little bit of a yellow background wouldn't be such a big deal, but it's blotchy. Most of the screen will be a yellowish color while there are small sections that are the bluish white color. I notified Amazon of this and they sent me out a new one but the new one was actually worse than my original. The "blotchiness" was larger and the yellow color was more noticeable. Plus, the blue/purple color was more noticeable as well. I also went to Best Buy to look at the HDXs and the yellow color was on those as well. This yellow color in a lighted environment is subdued, but when you're reading at night in bed with the lights off, the yellow color and blotchiness is very noticeable.Another disappointment is the battery power. The battery doesn't last anywhere near as long as the HD. As I said, I read alot and before with the HD I could go weeks without having to recharge which was great with the amount I travel so I wouldn't have to bring the cords because I could just recharge back at home. However, with the HDX, I have to recharge every 3-4 days which means I have to bring the cords with me when I travel.The Mayday feature is NOTHING like they show on TV. The video is not very clear and the audio is very delayed. The service reps also don't know anything other than telling you to reset the device and then if that doesn't work, someone will call you back on the phone, thereby not even using the Mayday feature.Also, the screen on the HDX is no better in the sun than the HD, which I was led to believe it would be better. Not sure if this was a misunderstanding on my part, but it's not better than the HD. In comparison with the iPad (mini), the iPad is way better to read in the sun and I don't mean just a little better, but way better.I'm just very disappointed. I've never had any problems with Amazon before but it just seems they didn't think things through on the HDX. The Kindle has always been a great reading device, so it seems they wanted to improve the viewing experience for games and movies/TV to be better than Apple. But they did it at the expense of the reading experience, which is a big disappointment for those of us that like to read.I could continue asking for new HDXs, but what's the point? I've already seen 4 and they've all had this problem, and the replacements could be worse than the original like my one replacement already was. Do I go back to the HD? If I do that I lose the ability to download the prime TV/movies which is a great feature. Do I get a Kindle paper white for reading? Well, then I have to carry 2 tablets with me which is ridiculous. Should I purchase the 8.9 inch which supposedly doesn't have some of these issues? Well, the 8.9 inch is bigger, bulkier, heavier and more expensive and space/weight is a premium with the amount I travel. Do I begin using my iPad mini? Then again I lose the ability of the prime downloading. So I guess I'll keep the original HDX and hope Amazon addresses the reading issues on the next upgrade, but with the way they've been responding with these issues on the HDX, it seems like they don't think the issues are a problem.So, if you'll primarily use the 7 inch HDX for gaming, and viewing videos, you'll probably really enjoy it. However, if you plan to read a lot on the HDX, this is probably not the device for you.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressive
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "jlambert1982"
Reviews.Content: Pros:The size.  I have an original iPad and an 8.9 Fire HD from last year.  I never thought I'd be want the smaller size, but this is perfect.  I no longer play games on my phone, b/c this thing is easy enough to carry around I take it everywhere.  In fact, if I didn't use my phone's hotspot to give this thing connectivity I would consider dropping my phone all together and using this thing to make calls from.The screen.  This thing looks amazing.  A co-worker has the new iPad Air. Side by side we both think this little guy blows it out of the water.  We pull up the same images from google and it is easy to see the difference.The performance.  My biggest complaint about the 8.9 Kindle Fire HD was that it was laggy.  Pulling up apps would take too long compared to my Galaxy S 4 or my son's iPod touch.  Apps would crash before they opened.  Videos would stall between clicking play and the video actually playing.  This little powerhouse has eliminated almost all of that.  Apps still crash, but I'll get to that later.Cons:Storage.  I live on a farm.  Beyond satellite and cell coverage I have no options for high speed internet.  I do get LTE where I live, but that is on a limited basis, and my satellite broadband has a data cap as well.  It would be nice to download season's of television while I am at work or travelling and store them on my device.  64GB seems like a lot, but between apps, books, audiobooks, and HD video, it still fills up fast.  A 128GB version would have been worth it to me.Video output.  On my Kindle Fire HD I could bring an HDMI cable with me wherever I went, and as long as there was free HDMI input on the television, I could watch my videos.  Now I have to watch through my PS3 (which I could already do with Amazon Instant Video) or the newer Samsung televisions (but not my 2011 55 inch LED).  Kind of frustrating.  Even my kid's iPod Touch has HDMI out with an adapter.App availability.  I love Amazon App Store.  It is a lot easier to navigate than Google Play, and you don't have the multitude of worthless apps.  However, there are tons of apps that I use on my phone that just are not available through Amazon.  I use Google Voice to check voicemails and send messages.  While I can do that through the Silk browser, why can't I have that option?  Everyone I know who owns a Kindle Fire has their own personal complaint about an app they can't use.Summary:I love my HDX.  To me, this is the perfect size for a tablet, and this thing performs like a monster.  It has replaced all my other tablets.  I still have a very large library of movies and TV shows in iTunes, and it continues to grow b/c of my wife's love of her iPhone and my kid's reliance on their iPods, so I can't just shut down my iTunes account yet.  For me personally, however, I'll never have to use iTunes again.  Everything this device is supposed to do, it does great.  It is a great e-reader.  It is a great video player.  It is a great music player.  I started reading comics again when I bought the 8.9 inch Fire HD last year because of how great that device was for the comic book format.  The 7 inch HDX is just as good.  Note taking, game playing, time killing.....You name it, this device does it.Right now I don't know who I wouldn't recommend this to.  Thinking about spending 150 bucks on your kids and buying them a LeapPad Ultra?  Spend the extra money up front and get them a device that is worth the money in the long run.  Between the free apps and device quality, that is a no brainer.Have grandparent who watches old TV channels and reads books?  Give them this and tell them to pay for Prime, and cancel their cable bill.My only complaints are minor.  I knock off one star because I don't like the idea of being locked into their ecosystem of apps.  That is very Apple of them, and while I understand the business to it, I still don't appreciate it.  If I could make any improvements, I wish Amazon would let me import my library of videos from iTunes to their cloud like they did my music.  If they could make that happen, I would be a fully converted form .mac fanboy.Buy without hesitation if you are a Prime member or just starting your digital video library.  I would hesitate slightly if I had thousands invested in iTunes videos and apps, but even then, for $230, it may be worth it just to see if you like it better.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet but still room for improvement
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I've previously owned one other tablet -- the iPad 1.  I received it as a birthday present ~3 years ago, and sold it last year back to Apple as part of their buyback program.  I liked the iPad, but found it slightly too heavy, wide, and slow (after upgrading iOS).  The screen resolution also was subpar compared to modern standards.Fast forward to today and I've dove head-first back into the tablet world with the 7" Kindle Fire HDX.  All of my complaints stated above are no longer apparent with the Kindle Fire HDX.  It is light, narrow (can easily grip with one hand, although not as narrow as the Nexus 7), and whip-fast.  Screen resolution is as crisp as they come.My biggest complains are that (1) the ads are semi-annoying, and (2) the whole "user experience" appears to revolve around the consumer buying a bunch of stuff from Amazon.  With the Nexus 7 or iPad, there is less emphasis on "buying stuff" and more emphasis on "doing stuff" (e.g. a less commercial experience).Still, for the price ($179 on Cyber Monday), I can't complain too much.  I will say, though, that depending on the promotion at the time, if the Nexus 7 and Kindle HDX are the same price, I'd probably actually prefer the Nexus 7 for a more traditional tablet experience.  Sorry Amazon.  Still, nice tablet at a good price

Reviews.Title: There's only one thing I regret about buying the HDX 7", Wi-Fi, 16G . . .
Reviews.Author: mllecheree
Reviews.Content: I should have bought the 32G.Pretty much everything is an improvement over the HD: speed, the Mayday button, audio, clarity, viewing angle, weight, ability to stream wirelessly to the TV (but needs extra equipment or the right TV). It's light enough that I'm thinking about abandoning my Paperwhite. The cube charger is included in the box, so that's one accessory you don't have to buy. Speaking of accessories,  the origami case is nifty and very stable in landscape, but a touch heavy and it's slightly tilted in portrait.It's my own fault I didn't get the 32G.  If I'd read the blurb carefully, I'd have seen that one can download some of the Amazon Prime Instant Videos. This comes in handy when streaming Wi-Fi isn't an option -- like on a plane or at my parents' house, but that's another story.

Reviews.Title: flawed devices
Reviews.Author: AmyE "revuer"
Reviews.Content: Got the Kindle hd  to upgrade/replace the kindle fire that has problems with the charger port..  The customer service seems good,  but I regret the many hours I spend trying to remedy what I now know to be a common problem with the Kindle HD-  wifi connection problems .  My original Kindle Fire gets the wifi signal both Kindle HD are missing.Amazon- this is a time killer for all involved. Please build these devices right in the first place.

Reviews.Title: CLShopper
Reviews.Author: Crystal L. Sanders
Reviews.Content: Love my Kindle!! This was the best thing I could l have treated myself to in along time. I play my kinda games watch tv shows, movies, do my banking and shop!! WooooWE..!!!

Reviews.Title: This AIN'T an Android.... but it is an OK reader. If you want a Kindle Reader at Android prices go for it....
Reviews.Author: F Mills
Reviews.Content: For some reason (sure it is profit motivated) Amazon decided to cripple the Android OS and uses instead "Fire OS".The down side of this is that almost none (true statement) of your Android Apps will work on this device...EVER.What I needed was a Kindle reader to read Windows 8 blocked books (yes you read that right "WINDOWS BLOCKED" books". This means that Android and Windows Kindle Apps cannot read all of the Kindle books????? LIKE TEXT BOOKS. Forcing some to buy Kindle Readers to partner with their other mobile devices????There are some "workarounds" that themselves ALSO need "workarounds" and only work sporadically at best.If I had done my homework and read up on the Fire HDX I would have bought a cheap Kindle  for the text books and a Galaxy for an Android. I would have all I need and a REAL Android to boot...Before you buy check your options.....(do your homework).... You will be glad you did....

Reviews.Title: An Great Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Glenn
Reviews.Content: We were satisfied with our original Kindle which allow us to get our newspapers and books downloaded.  We didn't really care about the color or other utilities that the new Kindle products allowed users to do.  Then, our original Kindle battery failed, so an upgrade was necessary.  Even then, we didn't desire a Kindle Fire with HDX display, but in reviewing the options, features and price, we decided to get the Kindle Fire HDX.  We were genuinely impressed with the HD quality of the screen, the features, the connectivity to the internet, and the impressive array of services.  Only once have we contacted the online support (Oh, so easy with the touch of a screen button) to be instructed about how to connect the Kindle Fire to our Miracast feature on the Panasonic Blu-Ray to our large screen Toshiba display.  We are still learning, but are impressed with the intuitive features and the mobility/utility of the Kindle Fire HDX.

Reviews.Title: Happy Spouse
Reviews.Author: Ben BaRSTAD
Reviews.Content: My wife is very hapy that I purchased the Fire HDX7 for her. She uses it daily. It has the speed required for worthy use.

Reviews.Title: Had problems but finally satisfied!
Reviews.Author: Lorraine Mayercak
Reviews.Content: By purchasing this tablet I encountered both problems with my account and problems with my device which took a numerous amount of phone calls and aggravation to correct. If I hadn't been a satisfied Amazon customer for the past 15 years I would have returned my tablet and demanded my money back. But I knew from past experience that this is not how Amazon usually operates, so I didn't give up. When I ordered the tablet and accessories I was promised promotional credits plus amazon coins plus bonus credits for some of the app purchases. Half of the credits promised did not show up in my account, and when I tried to use the credits I had, additional credits were deducted that should not have been. After many calls to Amazon, it was finally discovered that a computer glitch was the cause of the problem and it was corrected. My first tablet was difficult to use and some of the menu options were missing and I didn't know it. The online help files did not include descriptions of problems that can occur with a defective tablet so I kept thinking I was doing something wrong. (It would be extremely helpful if the help files could be downloaded as a PDF) After many calls to Amazon, I was finally transferred to a very unpleasant technician who determined my tablet was defective and sent me a brand new replacement tablet exactly like the one I had. When I asked about all the books and apps I had downloaded into the device he told me they would be in the new tablet when I got it. He lied.......the tablet was empty just like the original, but it was a new replacement so I didn't complain. It took me 3 days to reload 246 books and 65 apps into the new tablet........it would be helpful if there were a "select all" option in the cloud but there isn't and if the downloading is not monitored it stops after a short time. I now have a Kindle Fire HDX that works as it should and no longer regret my purchase! This tablet works extremely well and the graphics quality is amazing! I would have given it 5 stars but have deducted 1 star for the aggravation I went through with the first tablet which should not have happened.

Reviews.Title: Great customer service
Reviews.Author: Claudia Lohr
Reviews.Content: I bought this device during mother day's sale. It arrived promptly and I was thrilled to start to play around. We already own a Kindle Fire first Generation and really like that device.Unfortunately I might have gotten a lemon first. It immediatly shut off after few seconds, sometimes minutes.So I contacted the customer chat, if I could do something against that. They very really kind and nice and after some minutes of talking about the problems they said they send me another device. It arrived 2 days later and works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Why is the power button in the back of the Kindle?
Reviews.Author: plainteacher "readeverything"
Reviews.Content: I got the HDX as a replacement for my original Kindle Fire.  Setup was easy.  Great!!.  However, my original Kindle is in a case.  I want the HDX in a case.  So....Why in the world is the on button in the back of the HDX.  Okay, it is accessible in my old case, but it is not in what I would consider an ideal location.  Did you guys at Amazon really think this through.  I think not.  Shakes my head and face palm too.

Reviews.Title: It's good
Reviews.Author: Ronald Hidalgo
Reviews.Content: It's a very good product.  The FreeTime for the kids does leave a lot to be desired though.  The kindle controls criteria too much and does let the user set the apps that the kids can use in the educational time.  The Free Time Plus for 2.99 is an awesome deal though. Stuff to keep them busy forever and changes fairly often. It would be nice to be able set different passwords for the Parental Controls for older kids to use the main screen and still give them access to the free time plus stuff with a different password that wouldn't let them use the credit card!

Reviews.Title: well made
Reviews.Author: Carrie Parker
Reviews.Content: Like this item, quick and takes up less space than a laptop..only suggestion would to chance the camera so pictures could be taken both ways

Reviews.Title: KINDLED MANIA
Reviews.Author: Grammy M.
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire is easy to use.  In fact, I have to admit it is a little addictive.  The color is great. The options are endless. I particularly like the beige colored pages for reading.

Reviews.Title: I like it, but it takes to long to charge
Reviews.Author: Carrie Sanders
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle, but I misplaced my charger, so now it takes forever to charge, but there are tons of good fre books on the amazon market which is a plus

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The only problem I have is that I needed more memory. It says 16GB but once you set it up, you only have less than 12GB to use. I've had to leave a lot on my cloud in order to use it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: T. Thelemarque "tmarque27"
Reviews.Content: I love this kindle fire. I was tempted to buy one for myself. It was a gift for a child, clear screen, easy download and easy use. Wish the device speed was a bit faster at downloading when using wifi.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Arleta Spiger
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this Kindle.  This has been my third Kindle I have purchased and each one is so  much better and does so muchmore.  I would recommend this Kindle to everyone who loves to read,

Reviews.Title: Great  gift
Reviews.Author: Marti "book crazy"
Reviews.Content: Got this as a gift to replace my other kindle which finally gave out our 2 years - great updates to the old kindle.

Reviews.Title: Love my new kindle
Reviews.Author: Celeste J.
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize just how much I would enjoy a kindle.  It's great and super easy to use and navigate.  I take it everywhere with me.

Reviews.Title: KINDLE
Reviews.Author: Mike Loveall "SPAREPART"
Reviews.Content: BOUGHT IT FOR MY WIFE'S BIRTHDAY MOTHER'S DAY PRESENT AS SHE STILL HAS AN ORIGINAL KINDLE WHICH SHE ALSO STILL LOVES!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7.
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HDX 7. It is so much better then the old Kindle I had. Its easy to use, and easy to fix any problems that have come up so far, and I did not have many problems. I think it was just me getting use to useing it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: Jumper's Mommy
Reviews.Content: I was very undecided about what my next electronic purchase would be.  I looked into the Surface, other tablets and netbooks. After much research I decided to give this a try.  It exceeds all of my expectations!! I can look at word docs and with the purchase of an app I can edit them.  The picture quality is fabulous for surfing the web or playing games.  The size makes it handbag friendly, so it can go everywhere.Proud to be a Kindle HDX owner!!

Reviews.Title: Great choice
Reviews.Author: Silvia Eberly
Reviews.Content: Love my new Kindle, works just great for a small buz owner on the go. Recommend it strongly to all my friends

Reviews.Title: malfunction
Reviews.Author: David W. Fry
Reviews.Content: The tablet screen froze while in tutorial mode and could not be corrected through the troubleshooting instructions on line. yup.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet; but I can't pay for it.
Reviews.Author: J Sears
Reviews.Content: Don't buy anything with an amazon rewards card. If you sign up, you'll accumulate a balance, never get an actual card, never get a bill and then when you inquire with amazon - no-body can help. They send you to Chase, the bank that promotes the card. Once at Chase, they can't help you either since you don't know your acct number.The above scenario is true. search it here on the amazon forums and you'll see how many customers can't pay their bill.I'm selling my fire tv, my kindle fire hdx and ceasing all biz with amazon until they get their s*** together.Amazon, when you want your money just say please and I'll write you a check.Unfreakingbelievable, but true! Never again.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Baron Buckhiester
Reviews.Content: The Lack of a YouTube appChromecast functionality broken in HBO GOChromecast functionality completely missing from Amazon instant videoThis device has inspired me to let my Prime subscription lapse and escape from this awful, closed ecosystem

Reviews.Title: OK--Could be better
Reviews.Author: D. Creamer
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice device with two major drawbacks:1] Poor battery performance even when sleeping. Amazon's suggestion was turn off WiFi when not using it and/or shut it down completely. I consider both suggestions to be poor; WiFi should shut off by itself when sleeping.2] Can't access apps at the Google Play store, only those deemed worthy by Amazon. These are known apps, they are available on iPads and Android devices, and do not compete with any Amazon services.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Thomas Keith Bailey
Reviews.Content: Have IPad.  I find Kindle easier to navigate.  Love because can surf net, check EMail, and read my Kindle books. Price was great.As a Senior (late70's)..............all this in one device, fascinates me.Have recommended it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: WiFi drops on a regular basis.  Primitive browser with no option to use something else.
Reviews.Author: Inactive Fred
Reviews.Content: WiFi drops on a regular basis, about once or twice per hour UNLESS I'm watching a movie, then almost never.  The Silk browser on the HDX is pretty fast and supports bookmarks (hooray) but doesn't allow you to organize them into folders (lame).  Ditto for apps, I.e. no folders, just a long list. It's a great tool for watching movies and shopping on Amazon, but it gets failing marks as a general purpose tablet.

Reviews.Title: It's like Amazon was listening to me
Reviews.Author: cpareviewlady
Reviews.Content: I had the first generation Kindle Fire and loved it.  I would still have it except I left it in a hospital room and when I called the next day, no one turned it in.  I'm not surprised.  I've looked at iPad (and have an iPhone), but liked my first Kindle Fire so much, I wanted another one.Ok.  Let me get back to why I thought Amazon was listening to me.  It's the details.  So here goes.1st gen Kindle Fire-- had a short power cord.  This one is much longer-- regular email/forum help.  This has video support where you chat with a live rep.  Spooky and awesome!-- settings accessible by icon.  You can swipe down on the screen to get to it.-- no play counting. Not only can you see page counting, but it estimates how fast you read a page then calculates how long it would take to finish to book.I'll come back to more, but I need to get going.

Reviews.Title: I love my kindle HDX
Reviews.Author: Reanna
Reviews.Content: I use my kndle every day and AM SO happy I got 32 gig. I read and do a lot on my handheld device.

Reviews.Title: Use it daily
Reviews.Author: Susan R. Hamby
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire. I use it everyday. It holds so many books and the screen is so clear. Plus it fits right in my bag, and I can take it on the go with me. I cant say enough good things about the Kindle Fire. Anytime I need help Amazon had been right there to help me. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Silvia
Reviews.Content: Very nice tablet, the images are so clear is very fast, is easy to use. Love it, has a lot of apps

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Amer F. Ahmed
Reviews.Content: This has been one of the best purchases I've made in years.  I LOVE the picture and the functionality.  It's been great!

Reviews.Title: Great device weak ports
Reviews.Author: Hunter E. Beach "BeASH"
Reviews.Content: After owning this device less than two weeks i have had the charging port fail from normal use, there is no sign of damage to the port, so i am rather dissatisfied with that, but it is a great tablet for a great price and i highly reccomend it as such i am currently trying to get an exchange with amazon so if it turns out i just got a lemmon i will update this review to reflect that

Reviews.Title: kindle
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: The only complaint I have is. I am reading and all of a sudden it shuts completely down and turns itself back on and I have to figure out what page I was on.

Reviews.Title: Not perfect
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: Two things after a few days use:1. battery, 1 hour every night, 3 night, out of battery......... Worse than Surface....I had to assume it's weird case, and had to return it.2. If you have Kindle paperwhite for reading and iPad/Surface for games/apps, I don't think you need this product. It doesn't have as many apps as ipad, and for reading, not as good as paperwhite.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Theresa "TheresaJuneP"
