Reviews.Content: I just got my Kindle Fire DX and I have to say that it is awesome!!  Some people have complained about a blue haze and it is there but barely noticeable.  I do a lot of reading and have it set to the beige background and it is perfect.  The screen has barely any glare and it is extremely lightweight.  For the money you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: Get one now
Reviews.Author: Raven Turner
Reviews.Content: This is my first ever tablet and I love love love it. I can do pretty much everything with this and it's super fast. I love the camera on this. I brought this when it was on sale for $179 and I'm writing this review with my kindle

Reviews.Title: Awesome First Tablet.
Reviews.Author: Agente-004
Reviews.Content: My first tablet and I find that this is all I need. Since I am trying to do away with traveling with a laptop I chose this tablet with enough hard disk space for me to have movies and a few apps to keep me entertained throughout my travels wherever I may be,

Reviews.Title: SWEET
Reviews.Author: KBroadhead
Reviews.Content: This was a purchase for my daughter. Not only did it arrive quickly (thanks to Prime), it was easy to setup and get her books downloaded.

Reviews.Title: Nice addition
Reviews.Author: Harrison
Reviews.Content: This was an early Christmas present and I'm happy I bought it.  It's used every day and performs well.  The screen and sound are amazing.  Tons of apps.  Just wish there were some other features like the ability to change wallpapers or have access to the Google Play store. There are apps that I've purchased on the Play store that I would have to repurchase if I want them on the Kindle even though they are the same app. The Mayday feature is nice to have, I've used it once and saved me from doing the research.  Nice addition that I didn't think I would use as much as I do.

Reviews.Title: 10/10 would buy again
Reviews.Author: Antonio
Reviews.Content: Extremely fast, a joy to hold, long battery life (with careful use), with a decent office suite available. What's not to love?

Reviews.Title: Better than fire.  A caveman might disagree.
Reviews.Author: Christian Burnett
Reviews.Content: Got this for my girlfriend as a birthday present to replace her Kindle Fire HD.  She loves the lighter weight, brighter, clearer screen, and speed.

Reviews.Title: Great small tablet but wish it had a back facing camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire HDX 7".  It fits into my purse and does everything I need to do on the fly.  My calendar, contacts for email, books to read and a game to play if I want to.  The only thing lacking is a back facing camera.  I would love to take pictures when the occasion presents itself.  The front facing camera is great for Skype but I don't do that very often.  Maybe in the future Amazon may consider upgrading the Fire HDX with both a front and back facing camera.

Reviews.Title: It was a choice of Nexus 7 vs. Fire HDX ... I made the right choice
Reviews.Author: James C. Westland
Reviews.Content: It was a choice of Nexus 7 vs. Fire HDX ... I bought the Fire and made the right choice.  I've had this for a day now and am impressed by:1.Clarity and richness of the screen.  This is a perfectly good book reader; easy on the eyes2.Speed of processor, network access...it's very noticable (I have a Cisco E2500 router which takes advantage of MIMO and dual band)3.User Interface (users seem to prefer the native Android of the Nexus, but I actually like Kindle's simplicity)4.The Silk Browser does seem to be faster (x2-x3) than browsers on my Mac Air, or 4th Gen iPad5.Amazon's Prime video, etc. content ... I would download these anyway from another tablet, so why not AmazonThe biggest gripe of other reviewers seems to be Amazon's aggressive advertising and link to their ecosystem.  I have the special offers (cheaper) version, and don't really find the ads annoying (if I did $20 would fix that).  And I like the direct link to Amazon's content.  Nor does Amazon try to prevent you from sideloading APKs (they actually give you an installer on the device) nor from rooting (you can relatively easily install CyanogenMod I've heard).  In truth, I think rooting would be a big mistake, as you would lose out on Amazon's ecosystem without gaining anything.  The better route is to sideload the Nova Launcher (or there are several other launchers that do just as well) as they more or less remove any advertising, and give you a more conventional Android interface.  I make sure that I have links on the Nova Launcer dock to Amazon store and to Silk.  It's the best of both worlds.Update...I've had my HDX for two weeks now, and am pleased that Amazon has such a light hand in controlling their UI.  I've loaded the Nova Launcher on my HDX, with docked icons for Kindle Store, and Silk Browser.  The result is a better UI than IOS or Nexus 7.  Almost everything I want is sideloadable.  I tried sideloading GooglePlay (*HaHa*) but that didn't work for a fairly obvious reason -- Amazon did not want to be responsible for an App that collects payments outside their own ecosystem (it opens up a host of headaches for them).I purchased the NETGEAR Push2TV Wireless Display HDMI Adapter - Miracast and WiDi (PTV3000) and after a bit of fiddling (I had to load the latest update to get the HDX to mirror) had it working.  For those who don't know, this essentially provides the sort of display mirroring on a TV that you get with Apple TV and the iPad, but without the content limitations.  It works flawlessly, and I have been using this more than my Roku3 to watch movies, YouTube, etc.  The X-ray feature on Amazon Videos is nice (essentially access to IMDB database while watching a movie) works well, and is actually quite useful.I even used the Mayday button once trying to set up the Netgear Push2TV ... it works as advertised and Amazon staff are great!In my opinion for a variety of reasons which I would classify under the general rubric of Amazon's "ecosystem" the HDX is better than Nexus 7 and iPad Mini-Retina (which is ridiculously overpriced), which makes it the best 7" tablet available.Oh... and be sure to buy the Amazon Kindle Fire HD Standing Polyurethane Origami Case (will only fit All New Kindle Fire HD 7"), Mineral Black ... this is (if you  look at product reviews) an unloved and misunderstood accessory.  I was not impressed when I first got it, but now that I own it, I think it is the best case out there (though too expensive in my opinion).  The stand and magnetic cover work as advertised.  The tray that the Kindle sits in is magnetic and holds the HDX well, but allows it easily to be removed and reinserted.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding with a couple of short comings!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great screen, but needs GPS CHIP.  Needs more recent version of Android.  Very good support. Otherwise competes well with Nexus 7.

Reviews.Title: HDX and Cover Eval
Reviews.Author: Marvin M.
Reviews.Content: Not the fault of the tablet but the cover for it is difficult to keep stable on many surfaces...plain ridge cover like the HD would be a nice. option

Reviews.Title: Excited
Reviews.Author: Amanda Vasquez
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the Kindle Fire HDX the picture and sound is amazing it did not disappoint what so ever. It's very easy to navigate around it, so you don't get lost.

Reviews.Title: SO NOT Worth It!!!.....Read Follow Up....
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I have only had this new Fire for a couple of hours, and have only had about 20 minutes to 'play' with it and I am already hooked!!  It is SO worth the upgrade to the HDX!  Love how user friendly it is, love the new email system, love the vibrant colors, love the feature that tracks how quick/slow you read and how much time/pages left to the end of a chapter.  This is just the beginning!  I can't imagine how much greater it probably is!  I can't wait to get the time to play with it more!  Thank you Amazon for another GREAT Kindle!A follow up!!!  Since my original review, I've had to return not only the original, but TWO more!!!  The first two would not hold a charge when in sleep mode.  The third one was charging for NINE hours and only made it up to 58% charged!  To make matters worse it came with no original box, which worried me as to if it was refurbished.  Amazon admitted it was a mistake and I was sent refurbished.  This has been a HUGE frustration dealing with having to call each time, packing them up and then making the 25-30 minute drive one way to our local UPS store!  I have no doubt I will love this device if I ever get one that works the way it is supposed to work!To date I have yet to receive an HDX that will hold a charge.  I am now on the 5th unit.  I cannot keep the internet on or will will drain within a few hours to dead.  In fact just downloading my latest books will drain at least 25% of my power that I had before turning on the internet to download the books.  Out of frustration I have kept this 5th one and just don't turn the internet on.  Now after just a month of using it, the screen keeps flashing like it is going to die/go blank.  This is the WORST problem I've ever had with any electronic device I've had!  Although Amazon is fine with sending replacements over and over there has been no compensation for my aggravation and the 1 hour drive to get it to the nearest USPS store to drop off the duds!VERY unhappy with Amazon at this point and I have lost a lot of faith in their customer service!

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Gloria E Shank
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Haven't had much time to apprciate it but love that I can check what email needs attention and light enough to carry w/me where ever I go.  I know that there's more but to busy w/holidays to take advantage.

Reviews.Title: Mayday very helpful, great sound and screen.
Reviews.Author: 12 Paw Ranch
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this from a Kindle Fire 7" that I bought about a year ago.  The reason I upgraded was to be able to download Prime videos.  The last thing I thought I would use was the Mayday button - I usually am the person that other people come to with electronics questions.  To my surprise, the Mayday button was helpful even for me.  There was a problem with me having too many Kindle devices registered, so my books would not open on the new device.  Even though I could have fixed that myself, contacting Mayday got the job done faster.  I talked with two Mayday operators since buying this new Kindle - both were easy to understand and knowledgeable.The sound and HD screen is very impressive, a big improvement over my Fire from 2012.  The processor is also impressively fast.  I have to say that battery life is not great, but adequate.  I have yet to try using the device with the WiFi off, which likely would improve battery life.  I don't find the special offers to be intrusive - they are only on the unlock screen, and are kind of like a screen saver.  There actually have been times when I have looked into the offers, so for me the extra cost to remove the offers would not be worth it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7" HDX
Reviews.Author: Marianne Nyberg
Reviews.Content: Love the new kindle HDX.  Clarity is very sharp although still a little hard to read in the sun.  (Maybe too sharp).  Still learning all the functions.  Wish there was a way to down load a full manual, vs sections at a time.Hard to sync pictures from an android phone.Not as easy to find the prime books and movies available, but with the help of the mayday button, you easily learn.Glad I up graded.

Reviews.Title: Fun to Use
Reviews.Author: NW "Beachlady"
Reviews.Content: Fun to use, fairly powerful, but has locked up on me a few times.  Hopefully locking up won't happen again.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Richard Eller
Reviews.Content: This probably is the best deal out there. It's the perfect size to be really something you can slip in your pocket or with a nice protective cover take along with you since it's smaller than a paperback. The display is awesome! The images are just like being there. The sound is great, but I wish there was a little more volume on the hi side. I got the 32GB with WI-FI only and all I can say is the competition really needs to look at what you can achieve for an economical price. I like how it automatically updates the software without having to search for it, and MAYDAY is just one of the most fantastic features, no one has anything like this. I had just bought a e-ink reader about three weeks before buying the Kindle Fire. All I can say, is, it's worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: Great for wireless display!
Reviews.Author: dchickles
Reviews.Content: Great little device for the price. Works perfectly for watching amazon videos on TV (in conjunction with my Netgear PTV3000)

Reviews.Title: Wonderful item
Reviews.Author: GENE
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful item. I have only scratched the surface of using it. The help button is ideal when I get stuck on something. Amazon has a winner here.

Reviews.Title: Gift for brother
Reviews.Author: Sebastian Perez
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my brother. He loves to read. He love the easy way you can buy books to read.

Reviews.Title: I would recommend the Kindle fire HDX
Reviews.Author: austin gabhart
Reviews.Content: My Kindle fire is awesome ,picture is crisp and clear, I have watched movies on it and stereo sound is unbelievable. My wife bought an iPad and my Kindle fire HDX has a much better display , it has a ,quad core processor it's very quick on the Internet, playing games .. It does have one fault it only has a front facing camera, other than that if you're looking for a lightweight very fast excellent display tablet you can't go wrong with this

Reviews.Title: mayday is great
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: love it - just wish the sharing library was more liberal with # of times you can share a book.  MAYDAY is great

Reviews.Title: Why I like the kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Ryan J.Kontny
Reviews.Content: The Kindle fire HDX is better than my old kindle fire. I like the Mayday button the advisor helped me turn off the screen reader feature. When I turned it on by mistake.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX Is Awesome
Reviews.Author: Prairie
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience with the Kindle Fire and I was really surprised how much I can do with it. I thought Kindle's were just for reading books or playing games but it is so much more than that.

Reviews.Title: i love it.
Reviews.Author: lindsay
Reviews.Content: i love this tablet. the mayday button is a great thing for a Luddite. i still have not figured out all the bellsand whistles but i like what i have so far.

Reviews.Title: Another step of improvement
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: This is the third Kindle and second Kindle Fire I have owned.  The HDX is even sharper than the HD is.

Reviews.Title: Great machine, enable Hulu with the Silk browser.
Reviews.Author: lancebenton
Reviews.Content: Great machine.  I bought this and my wife has a Kindle Fire HD.  We also subscribe to Amazon Prime.  My squawk is that the Silk browser does not work with Hulu (previews only) and they want you to subscribe to Hulu plus.  Amazon prime offers lots of great free streaming programs but for Hulu programming I have to go back to my laptop and just use the regular web browser to go to Hulu.com  Maybe enable Hulu if you subscribe to Amazon Prime?  r/LOB

Reviews.Title: Kindle HDX are great
Reviews.Author: Goldfinger
Reviews.Content: love my Kindle, the picture quality is great; however the internet is not the greatest. I did not buy it for the internet so I would have to say I am very pleased with my Kindle.

Reviews.Title: I enjoy the enhancements, with a few exceptions
Reviews.Author: markh
Reviews.Content: I like the display, memory and speed.While reading and charging the usb cable must come out of the top. Add on the origami stand and I can not open it like a book (right to left).Since yesterday's update the device rebooted 2 or 3 times in 10 minutes while reading.This also places the light sensor were my hand swipe hovers causing backlight to dim.The volume does not APPEAR as loud as the fire hd-7.The battery life is definitely 10-20% shorter than the fire hd-7.Looking forward to loading it up with prime videos offline...8D

Reviews.Title: This is great, perfect for the traveler...
Reviews.Author: Bonnie J. Seagroves
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT tablet!  I had been debating whether to purchase something like this for years.  I am not someone who goes out and buys the latest and greatest- I keep things until they no longer work.  Last year I purchased a Kindle fire for my granddaughter who is 9, and I had the chance to use it a couple of times... This one has better picture and better sound.  It is a basic model- perfect for the person who travels and needs to check email, read, play games, and watch movies/listen to music.  I am in love with this and will keep it until it dies, just like my disc walkman!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Colors and Great Book Reader and E mail Function
Reviews.Author: dennis
Reviews.Content: I purchased for my wife, who at 69, is not a wiz and computers, no matter how long I teach her how to use it.  She did learn to sort of master the Kindle keyboard...(how hard is it to push a button to turn a page?), but could never learn how to remove the books she read from the reader (backspace)!But, she loves her new Kindle fire: the color, the finger motions, all seem to make intuitive sense to her, so the calls for help are few and far between.  The next step is for her do e mail on it and considering the issues she has had with both lap top and smaller pc; we will see.  I tried it and it is very simple and works well.  She is a single finger type artist, so the lack of physical keyboard will not be an issue.She is primarily a book reader and she loves seeing the book cover!

Reviews.Title: It's great! Fast!
Reviews.Author: C.M.
Reviews.Content: I bought this for myself as a B-Day gift and Love it! The only reason it received 4 stars is due to a kinda shorter battery life. (That is because an I pad charge lasts forever).

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7"
Reviews.Author: Phyllis Osback
Reviews.Content: I LOVE everything about it; except, the screen is very sensitive. Also, It turns and then I have to move it a lot to get it back to the way I want it.  I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE "May Day".  I originally purchased the new Nexus 7 2013 and was not happy with it at all.  I returned it and purchased the Kindle Fire HDX 7".

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for price
Reviews.Author: Richfella
Reviews.Content: I am happy with my purchase.  As someone who reads a lot of pdfs, the pdfs viewer, so far, has been flawless.  I loaded several textbooks to the cloud and read them with the doc viewer with no problems.  I will say that the feature that offers to finish your words is annoying at times, but adding words to the dictionary has improved its recognition of the jargon I use in my work.  Silk has crashed a few times, but it may be do to poorly designed websites with pop ups.  Otherwise, I have been pleased with the Kindle HDX and would recommend buying one.  I also watched Sharknado on it.  I didn't mind the small screen.

Reviews.Title: Very good upgrades for Fire
Reviews.Author: Robert Lombardo
Reviews.Content: Big improvement from the original Fire excel ant sound quick response great color,very comfortable watching movies.I quite enjoy listening to my music on cloud every night

Reviews.Title: My second kindle.
Reviews.Author: Lori A. Brown "labrown"
Reviews.Content: Just got it within a week and a half ago. Still learning about what it can do. Love it so far.

Reviews.Title: love the upgrade
Reviews.Author: larryl
Reviews.Content: I have the kindle fire hd from last year and bought the hdx from best buy because it was on sell. I wasn't going to upgrade until I experienced it at the store. I thought surely this demo unit can't be how the real one is. I was wrong. I have an iPad 4 (work provided), Motorola Xoom, galaxy tab 2, original kindle fire, fire hd, Toshiba thrive, and now the HDX and I can say without a doubt I have never ever ever experienced a tablet this fast and smooth. The iPad is smooth but not instant. I even tried the nexus 7 at best buy and nope. I feel like the hd speakers are a little better than this, but not much. Other than that I'm extremely pleased in this device and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Mayday works and so does this tablet!
Reviews.Author: Dwight Daugherty
Reviews.Content: I have had my 7" kindle HDX for about one month.  I couldn't be more pleased.  The screen is sharp as advertised.  It is light and easy to handle.  The only drawback is the light blue border when the screen is white.  Frankly it doesn't really bother me.  I did use the May day button to remove a popup screen I kept getting.  I was answered within 30 seconds, problem fixed within 3 minutes!  Wow!!!!  I haven't encountered anything this tablet can't handle.I am very pleased and would recommend this tablet to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Worthy upgrade from the HD
Reviews.Author: C. Winton "cwinton"
Reviews.Content: My first Kindle was the electronic ink version, which had the huge advantage of running for weeks on a single charge if you turned off communications.  Over the next 4 years I purchased the Kindle Fire, the Kindle Fire HD, and now the Kindle Fire HDX (64Gb), all 7" models.  Each Fire model has been a significant improvement over its predecessor, although of course none come remotely close to the battery life of the electronic ink models.  That being said, as a reader, battery life for all the Fire models is fine for those long airplane trips, where you have the bonus of the device playing music while you read.  Other reviewers have covered battery life for those willing to watch movies on such a small screen.  Being able to mirror movies from Amazon Prime onto my TV is good enough for my purposes.So what else is noticeably improved?  First off, the HDX is noticeably thinner, lighter, and faster.  Second, if your email requires VPN, there is an integrated VPN client that is almost trivial to set up (you may have to download the Thor OS upgrade for this, I did).  The provided email app connected easily for me. and I found new versions of apps I typically use, such as ES File Explorer and a really good (free) SSH terminal emulation app that works great on the HDX.I debated long and hard as to whether an upgrade from my HD was advisable at this time, and finally decided to take the plunge.  I'm glad I did.  The HDX is living up to the hype.  I even found the help feature useful.  It connected immediately to a knowledgeable individual who pointed me to the need to upgrade the OS in order to get the VPN client.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Bobbe
Reviews.Content: Loved the original Kindle Fire, this one is better.  This version is faster and brighter.  I am glad I upgraded.

Reviews.Title: e
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with the new kindle fire hdx.  I've only had it a little over 3 weeks.  Since I had it.  it constantly loses my wi-fi singnal (at least 2-3 times per day). Then to get it to reconnect I have to stand right next to my router.  This has become very annoying.  The other issue I am having is random shutdowns of my kindle for no reason.  It doesn't matter if I am in the middle of something on the kindle or not.  I have contacted support about these problems.  He did everything he could to help and then said he would have to contact the managers and he would keep me posted by email.  He sent a few emails telling me he was working on the problem and the last email I received stated his superiors said I should update my kindle with the new update because it would fix my problems..  I think he had forgotten we had already checked that and my kindle was up to date.  Therefore, I am no longer receiving any more emails about this issue which means the problems are not fixed and now I don't know what to do about it.  I have had 3 other kindles prior to this and have never had a problem.  I have the kindle for reading with the keyboard, kindle 1st generation, and the kindle fire 7" hd.  The only one purchased from Amazon is the new kindle fire 7" HDX  which I was very excited to receive and now I am having these issues.  I am especially disappointed that my problems have now been written off.  I am going to contact support again to see if they can help.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: tmr
Reviews.Content: picture quality, speed, size  only thing I miss is google play store but I have that on my 10" Toshiba  thrive.

Reviews.Title: Kindle LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Rae Jean
Reviews.Content: I love it.  This is one purchase I am glad I made.  I can check e-mails, facebook, read, play games.  LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: As versatile as a laptap or tablet.
Reviews.Author: Lorene Wilkerson
Reviews.Content: I love this because it substitutes for my laptop and is easier to carry with me in my purse.  I can receive emails and have documents sent to it which assists me at meetings.

Reviews.Title: amazingly easy to use
Reviews.Author: Jaime
Reviews.Content: Amazing! Easy to use. The colours are brilliant! I did not notice the blue tint or glow others described. Can't wait to watch more movies and tv! Great buy!

Reviews.Title: New kindle
Reviews.Author: Frank Latchford
Reviews.Content: Very nice and love it! This kindle is nicer than my old one! Much clearer especially for when I am playing my games!

Reviews.Title: Great Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Sharon Mcclellan "Garden Nana"
Reviews.Content: I really like this Kindle Fire HDX.  Great for travel.  I can access my accounts, read a book, enjoy Facebook and much, much more while traveling.  Much better than lugging around a big laptop.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Robert B. Miller
Reviews.Content: This unit is more powerful than my original Fire. I can surf the web more easily, and playing videos and music is a dream.

Reviews.Title: Apps
Reviews.Author: Joseph J DeLeone
Reviews.Content: I really like Kindle.  Some of the apps that I like have not worked. I am still learning how to utilize all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: Like the Product But Concerned About Quality of Hardware (had to get a replacement after a week of use)
Reviews.Author: Scott Gill
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle HDX for about a week now, and I had to call and get a replacement today. The Kindle won't charge. It will turn on as long as it's plugged into a power source, but as soon as I unplug the device, it shuts down due to low battery. They are sending me a replacement that should be here in a couple of days, but it leaves me to question the quality of the hardware on the new Kindle, in general. I wonder what will happen six months or a year down the road with my replacement.That said, I love the product for the week that I was able to use it. Love the interface, the picture quality, and the look and feel of the device. There are a few apps that I have on my Android phone that aren't available in the Kindle App store (like ESPN Fantasy Football), but I'm sure that more apps will be added over time.In conclusion: I like the product, but I'm concerned about the quality of the device hardware.

Reviews.Title: Very good buy
Reviews.Author: goal13keep
Reviews.Content: This is a great buy for the money. Much much faster than the original Kindle Fire. It's a great size and weight, and an excellent price. Overall I'm very happy with the way it functions. My only complaint is that the app store seems to be lacking some. I haven't been able to get some of the apps that I use on my other devices. The ads that show up on the lock screen are a bit annoying, but not overtly bothersome (as soon as you unlock to get to your main screen, the ads are gone).I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet - fast and high picture quality
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "shaoli"
Reviews.Content: Kindle fire hdx is a very good device. I like its wifi speed. It is faster than my iPad mini. The iPad mini paused a lot when I use it in my kitchen; the kindle fire hdx does not. Also picture quality of the kindle device is much better. It has a fluid key board too. Typing on screen is smooth and effortless. (Foreign language key board input is easy to set up.) I install apps by just searching on the internet with silk browser and install the android tablet comparable version. Of course you can go to the App Store to install apps if there are any. I have both App Store found apps and internet found apps installed. It is just like a powerful mini PC. One thing I would like to mention is that I do not see the blue edge issue at all. When I use my apps, the picture quality is superb. No distraction what so ever.

Reviews.Title: Great to have this gadget
Reviews.Author: Aldrich Farrel Saputra
Reviews.Content: Really love this kindle version, high end spec with a reasonable price. Technically speaking this was a good deal for me, the sound, the display, the reading experience is superb. even though i feel a bit frustrated with the region restriction.

Reviews.Title: laughing at auto correct!
Reviews.Author: a.seas
Reviews.Content: Love my new HDX7, camera ready,lots of fun,love the tech support , have used it  twice now! Both times the service was excellent,  And the price is great, for the HDX 7 , auto correct can get a bit annoying, but you do get good laughs from it.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: Sami B
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle and I use it every day. I love cloud for all of my pictures. I love to be able to go from facebook or pinterest to reading my books, to playing games all in one sitting. Best toy I have. ;-)

Reviews.Title: great !!!
Reviews.Author: MIGUEL ANGEL CALLAN
Reviews.Content: Simply greatMy first kindle and I have had no problems. I recommend it strongly. No regrets at all pals

Reviews.Title: E$asy to set-up
Reviews.Author: S. TANNENBAUM
Reviews.Content: Easy to set-up and use for a novice.  Tried Android based unit & after 5 hours gave up.  This I had set-up & running within 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: Hard to beat the price to feature ratio with this Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: KAYCEE
Reviews.Content: From its design to display to speed and functionality, Kindle Fire HDX is a very good tablet. Crystal clear HD display with the fastest processor in a tablet make it an attractive buy. A rear camera would have been superb along with a robust app library like the Google Play store. Also support for Google apps would't hurt. Great HD experience with Amazon Prime and Netflix. VUDU and other video apps need "sideloading" at the moment. Reading experience is amazing. Makes up for a great holiday gift this year.

Reviews.Title: Perfect travel companion
Reviews.Author: Jeff Fraley
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and my wife got this for me before my last long trip.  Excellent choice for reading books and watching HD movies.

Reviews.Title: Love this Kindle
Reviews.Author: Inga
Reviews.Content: It took me a long time to make the decision to buy a Kindle and now I am so happy that I did.  I can buy books and have them immediately and can easily take my "books" with me to read anywhere.  The lighted screen is wonderful as is the size. I looked at the Kindle Fire but this model is so much more user friendly.

Reviews.Title: kindle
Reviews.Author: Zach Braniger
Reviews.Content: I love the kindle fire hdx it has a great speakers and display is awesome I hpoe other rate 5

Reviews.Title: Glad I had to wait to buy a Kindle
Reviews.Author: C. Aronson
Reviews.Content: I was going to buy a Kindle a few years back, but instead, due to finances, went with an inexpensive tablet. I am now the proud and happy owner of the Kindle Fire HDX 7" 32 GB and loving it! I love the speed with which the pages load, and the clarity of the pages is unreal! I love reading and the pages are so easy to see in any light...regular room light, dark room, and outside. Playing games that I had previously played on my old tablet is a whole new experience. The games are more vibrant, and no hesitation.I haven't used the Kindle for music yet, but based on what other have said, I am sure it will be great.I do like that they are now including the rapid charger with the Kindle, rather than having to purchase one separately. I have not had the need to use the "Mayday" button yet, but it is nice to know that it is there when I need it.I have not had this Kindle too long, but I can't find anything I don't like. Should that change, I will update this review. I also want to add that I am a Senior Citizen and want to let other Seniors know that they should not be afraid to buy a Kindle...it is so easy to set up (open box, register) and use!While I was having regrets about not buying a Kindle the first time, I am glad I had to wait because I now have one that has been improved and that I expect to have for some time.

Reviews.Title: The new Fire HDX 32 GB is AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Sara Rice
Reviews.Content: Another great Amazon Kindle Fire. Super easy to set it up.  Open the box and turn it on.  Register it and you are good to go!I purchased this as a gift and my daughter loves her new Fire HDX.  It is smaller and lighter than her previous Fire and wow it does a great job.  My daughter uses it to listen to music and read books.  It also has a great browser so it's super fast for her to search the web.  I really like how she can also watch her favorite shows and movies and with Prime it's so worth it.There are plenty of Apps and I am really impressed how fast it is.  I would consider it as a really nice tablet and for the price, you really can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: A great tablet
Reviews.Author: Sally in Colorado
Reviews.Content: This kindle fire tablet is finally really a tablet.  I love it for reading, doing email and running apps.  I am an app developer and I am have written an app for iPad, and android. So I have tried them all.  I own Samsung Tab 3, Nexus 7, 2 iPads and a kindle (1st gen). So I am very familiar with all these tablets.  I would have given it 5 stars, but the apps on iPad are better and more of them. It could also use a back camera to be competitive but I never use that anyway.  For the price, Amazon has done an excellent job on this device.  I even used the "May day" service a few times when I got it.Later:  I am finding the battery usage frustrating.  The battery doesn't last as long as my laptop.  It runs done faster than any other tablet that I own (iPad, Samsung Tab 3, Nexus 7). So I am down grading my rating.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: First tablet ever and I LOVE IT!! Has everything I need and more!So glad I purchased it and the price was the best! I've waited for this and couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Enids review
Reviews.Author: catwalk
Reviews.Content: I find the quality of pic excellent. I love the video link to movies and television shows. I just wish there were more television shows available. The Kindle Fire HDX is easy to use. The streaming is fast.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Dorothy Facklam
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HDX. I am still learning a lot about it and how to use it. I never had a tablet before and this is nice because it is the right size to take any place with you.

Reviews.Title: Kindle hdx is easy on the eyes
Reviews.Author: J Pearson
Reviews.Content: What an awesome product.  I really enjoyed using it, but decided I preferred a regular camera & purchased the 8.9.  I returned this product. The camera on the 7" is fine for Skype, but it is very disconcerting to use it for anything else.  I previously had the ipad2.  The fire hdx turns on & starts up rather slowly.  But the quality of picture and ease in reading books creates a wondrous experience.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Laura Schering
Reviews.Content: Love this tablet. Has met all my ends plus. Easy to use. Very sensitive to the touch. Graphic s are clear, bright and excellent.

Reviews.Title: Good product, brilliant display, horrible charging setup.
Reviews.Author: dwaynebrady
Reviews.Content: Simply love this kindle.It's good for reading, fits into my pocket great for watching video while in bed too.The battery seems to be pretty good ( I keep it on airplane mode most of the time for reading) but the battery seems to last for 3-4 hours of video if not more.Only complaint will be the charging time and the charger they initially give you.

Reviews.Title: Enjoy my new kindle HDX
Reviews.Author: Geari Viney
Reviews.Content: Does everything I want but it did drop my email server several times and has to be reinstalled.  New Toy

Reviews.Title: Huge improvement!!!
Reviews.Author: George Lowe "B. Lowe"
Reviews.Content: Huge improvement over my 1st generation Fire. Beautiful display. Good browser. Almost comparable to wife's Ipad Mini but not quite, and a whole lot cheaper. Buy it!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet, Love It !
Reviews.Author: S. Schuchhardt "SUZ"
Reviews.Content: This is an Awesome tablet. No complaints. I take it with me where ever I go. Use it in waiting rooms while waiting for appointments. For shopping lists, reminder notes. At home I don't have to be stuck in my office to read my email or to connect to family and friends on fb. Also use as alarm clock and time reminder so my day doesn't get way from me. I love it so much that each of my grandkids is getting one for Christmas. Shhhh don't tell.

Reviews.Title: Love My Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Eileen
Reviews.Content: Perfect size. Very user friendly. Great resolution. A bargain compared to other tablets. Very fast with quick access to the Internet. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Khnet
Reviews.Content: Fantastic tablet, great for kids too. I love the kindle free time features and limits you can set. Easy access and fun to play with

Reviews.Title: It's good but not great
Reviews.Author: bluewolf37
Reviews.Content: I have owned several different tablets and didn't wow me like i was hoping it was going to.Pros* The speakers are wonderful compared to all of my old tablets and some old laptops.* The touchscreen is the most responsive touchsreen that i have ever used. (i didn't realize my old tablet had lag until i used this)* it's fast all around from loading apps to starting a movie* The screen is beautiful when watching movies.* it feels very solid in the hands like it is built well.* If you have amazon prime you have access to the kindle lending library and amazon prime videos (this was the reason i decided on kindle this time)*the app store has comixology* It has a feature called Quiet time so you don't get notifications wanking you up when you are asleep* Wireless reception is very strong and stable.* Amazon music store is normally cheaper and better than itunes and the play store. (I love the fact that i don't have to download my music to every device i own to listen to it)* it is a good price.* Some movies and books have a wonderful feature called X-Ray that gives you useful information. In movies it can tell you the actors and actresses on screen and what song is playing. If you click in the names out connects to imdb for more info.Cons*you cannot connect to the play store and the amazon app store is extremely lacking and/or outdated. You can sideload some apps but any that connect to google services wont work 100%. For example I sideloaded chrome and even though I can use it to browse i cant sign in to sync bookmarks with my computer and phone. I also got the youtube app and it worked but once again you cant sign in to see all your subscriptions. Gmail is compleatly useless...Etc...*There is a blue haze around the edges of the screen that is almost painful when reading. I ended up changing kindle reading settings to a night mode so it didn't bother me.*apps that had no problems on other tablets or phones seem less stable on the kindle. I bought a game on the amazon app store and it ended up blue screening the device which was surprising since i never had a tablet give me the blue screen of death before (but to be fair it hasn't had a problem since then )* battery life when watching videos is worse than my asus tablet* you don't see the date when you pull down the notification barLast thoughts*It is probably a good idea to add a password to the kindle because it is always signed into amazon. This includes their kindle books store, app store, music store, and physical product store. So if you have kids or fear it may get stolen a password is a good idea. I would also look into the parental controls.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable and Unimpressive
Reviews.Author: JVR Mom
Reviews.Content: This was the 4th Kindle Fire we recieved.  #1 wouldnt connect to WiFi #2 Battery dead less than 90 mins #3 dead battery AND WIFI issues... i continues to give them a try becuase the Kindle Free time seemed like a good value for my 3 yr old.Unimpressed by Kindle Free time content.  Id prefer to spend a few bucks each month and own the content of my choice.  We will purchase another MS Surface Table and a kid friendly case.

Reviews.Title: What a heartbreak! You Can't Use GOOGLE!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought my very first tablet, the Kindle Fire. I was so excited when it arrived. I put on the screen protector, put it in it's case, set it up with my acct information. I was in awe of the look and feel of it. It is beautiful! The picture and sound are amazing too. If you love Amazon, this is probably exactly what you want!I went into the situation blind. I read a lot of kindle books so I thought the Fire would be great. I didn't understand that a tablet would block you from using specific programs they deem competition. I use Google Music, I pay for unlimited music each month. It never occurred to me that I wouldn't be able to stream my music over my tablet! It doesn't make any sense to me! My HTC phone, which uses google, lets me download Amazon apps so why wouldn't Amazon let me use Google?!I went into chat with an Amazon rep to find out if there was anything I could do to get my music on it. They said no, they were sorry. They said I was free to buy music from them tho. Of course I am but I don't want to buy every stupid song that pops into my head. I'd go broke!And they don't offer anything like unlimited streaming that I could switch to.In looking through the kindle apps, I also learned that the Google apps that are offered (maps, gmail) had horrible ratings with comments that they don't work at all.I am a HUGE Amazon fan. And even through this, I am a loyal customer. But I am  so deeply disappointed. I am disappointed that they have chosen an isolationist approach to their product. Having my music available to me would not have taken any dollars away from them. I still would have bought my books and movies through them. Probably a lot more than I do now. I don't buy my music thru Amazon, I buy it thru iTunes. I always have and I always will. I keep my music on Google Music. I use the unlimited music to hear new songs so I know if I want to buy it or not. By not letting me stream music they've lost book and movie purchases. They never would have had much music business from me. Maybe some, bec I might be too lazy to use iTunes. The thing is, I have my way of doing things. I use many products. I don't want to feel contained or limited or be forced into changing for literally a BAD BUSINESS decision by Amazon.I wanted the kindle bec I thought it might be nice to use in the kitchen or around the house specifically for entertainment purposes. Reading, music, movies, tv shows. A sort of all purpose entertainment center. Like they advertise. What they don't say on their product page is that you won't be able to use Google services. It should be very specific for people like me who are new to the tablet world. I bought a case and protective covers and the warranty.  Amazon is charging me money for the returns and some of it can't be returned. I feel like they withheld important information and now I am paying the price for it.I did some research last night and decided to go with the second generation Nexus. It will stream music, allow Amazon apps and it has a cute keyboard.  They don't force me into using them exclusively!Amazon is really on the wrong side of this!!

Reviews.Title: So disappointed
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I spent months reviewing and comparing tablets, and as an avid Amazon-user I thought I had made a well informed choice. Wrong. This tablet honestly stinks. The technology seems half-baked. Some of the programs work flawlessly while others are glitchy and frustrating. For example, I can't even access the app store but the silk internet browser works fine! The app store half loads, and none of the links even work. It's definitely not my internet connection, because all of my other devices are running flawlessly. I read a bunch of blogs and tried doing a few things (resetting time/date settings, restarting the kindle, checking internet settings...) I am just so disappointed. As a Mac user, I probably should have shelled out the extra cash and went with the iPad. I am returning this tablet after only one day. Even worse, the Mayday button won't connect me to customer service! It just loads for a while and then reports an error in connection. A rare miss for my Amazon experience.

Reviews.Title: OK, one star says I hate it, not the device, but the experience.
Reviews.Author: FromUtah
Reviews.Content: This device is a handy little device, good graphics, amazingly large sound.  Runs fast, apps that come with it work fine.But...If you want access to all of the open source a freely available software from Google, don't buy this!!!  It is not available, nor will it ever be.  That mean no Google Play, Google Maps, Google Navigation, Google Search, Google Chrome, Google Docs, Google Translate... You get the picture.  Why would anyone want to limit themselves to the offerings at the amazon App Store with such a great little tablet?  Kindle Fire HDX is just a version of Android with an Amazon makeover.  Every aspect of this experience of using this device seems to be geared toward getting you to spend money at Amazon.  Right off the bat you are given a free month of Amazon Prime, the service that costs $79 per year.  They offer streaming videos, but, everything here is on Netflix.  Netflix has more.  Most TV series let you view the first episode for free, but all others cost money.Did I mention, the startup screen is a full-page add for some random irrelevant gadget on Amazon?  And, The top of the screen on the launcher page is, you guessed it, another link bar to Amazon Store Categories for you to accidently click when you want to slide down the top bar to check what messages have been displayed.Now, let's talk google.  Google invented the droid operating system and the google play store has everything under the sun for Android.  Apps like Google Chrome, Gmail, Google Maps, Navigation, Google Drive.  These are not available on the Amazon store.  They really make up the backbone of productivity on the Android system.  Amazon seems to only want you to use this for entertainment, on a pay-as-you-go basis.I'll be looking for a way to load generic Android, or selling this on eBay.Amazon, if you read these, please come out with a more open update for this device's operating system.  I feel like a sucker for getting this.Mine is for sale.

Reviews.Title: Too many problems before but problem was Comcast Router and not kindle. I now recommend the Kindle HDX.
Reviews.Author: Angel Book Reader "book reviewer"
Reviews.Content: Update 02/17/2014I can now recommend the Kindle Fire HDX. I am changing 1 star to 5 stars. After posting the original review, amazon contacted me and worked with me. I finally spoke with someone in the kindle support who could help me. The problem was the Comcast Arris Modem/Router I was using. Last friday, I bought a Netgear modem from Best Buy and an Belkin N+ router. All problems have disappeared. My kindle is now working fine. If you are having wifi problems and battery drain issues, it might be your Comcast router. Do not return your kindle, just get a new modem/ router and the problem should be solved.Original Review:**********From the outset, I want to state that I will not recommend the Kindle HDX 7. I own five Kindle devices, 4 Kindle HDs and 1 Kindle HDX. I had pre-ordered the Kindle HDX when Amazon announced it and I received it three days before it was sold to the public. Within a month of receiving the HDX, I had problems and had to contact Amazon for a replacement. They quickly sent me a new replacement kindle. The new kindle has been giving me lots of problems: disconnects constantly from the wifi, drains battery power even when it is not in use. Keep in mind, none of my Kindle HDs that are already over a year old have any of these problems. At first, i thought the problem was the Amazon kindle hdx case I had on it. I took the case off and still experienced the same problems. This has been going on since December. I have factory reset several times and the problem is still not solved. Last week I contacted Amazon, they sent me a refurbished replacement kindle (nervous knowing that the kindle I received had prior problems and that is why it is refurbished.). It looked used. I used it for a day and noticed problems with it. I contacted Amazon again and insisted they should send a new kindle because I am tired of driving to UPS to return defective kindles. The representative said he was placing an order for a new kindle for me. Today, i just got another refurbished kindle. I contacted customer support and I was told that as per the terms of agreement, a replacement kindle may be a used device. She informed me that if I have any problems with it, I should contact them and return it for a replacement. I am again nervous this might have issues again. I am crossing my fingers. If I have any issues, I will just return to a kindle HD. I like the new kindle because it is smaller and the display is better. Amazon will never tell us how many people have returned these kindles but I am sure a lot have been returned. I love amazon and I spend a lot of money on Amazon but unfortunately this might be my last kindle if Amazon does not make right with me. For now, I will not recommend the purchase of the HDX until amazon is able to deal with the technical issues with this device. I feel like I just paid $230 to buy a beta device. My ipad and iphone which I use a lot (90% more than the kindle) have not shown any problems like my kindle is.

Reviews.Title: Not user friendly!
Reviews.Author: DrumKing
Reviews.Content: I don't like the format it's in, not easy to navigate around.  We mainly got it for my son, my daughter has a Samsung 10.1 tablet, which is much easier to navigate.  But of course thru time I guess you could get used to it.  But my number one beef with it, is that if you, for example set a yahoo account, whenever you hit email icon, you're automatically logged in!  Really?  No password?  Which by the way, you cannot log out!! My Amazon account is the same!  My son finds something he wants and just purchase's it, luckily for me Amazon has to have "confirmation", otherwise I could be purchasing things I have no control over.It's not all bad I guess, if that's what you're looking for, but I just don't like the fact that there is no option of logging out.  I go to Amazon, log out, then click the Amazon icon and bam!  I'm back in!  WTF?!!  Not for me!  I hate it!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle HDX
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Roberts "kathyzjim"
Reviews.Content: Considering all the positive attributes of this tablet, the camera was designed by a MORON!  The camera view is of the person operating the camera.  If there is to be just one camera, it should be positions AWAY from the screen.  I will estimate less than 1% of users would use this tablet for video phone calls.  Beyond that, there is no use for a camera which looks at the operator.  Why would a tablet be built with video camera functions, and limit the video to the person who is operating the camera?  What would it cost, another dime to install a back side camera?  I suppose there is an aftermarket prizm attachment, to reverse the camera and make it usable?

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: We bought the Fire HDX for my father in law for Christmas. I chose the Fire based on reviews that described it as a great tablet for senior citizens. My husband and I are both iPhone and iPad users, but I had a Fire 2 years ago so I assumed it would be easy to help my FIL learn to navigate the Fire HDX. ( I sold the Fire as soon as the iPad Mini came out!) Now I really wish we had spent the extra $100 and bought the iPad for him. The HDX is just not as intuitive and easy to navigate as the iPad. Even though I had the original Fire I have to look up answers to his questions about navigating the HDX. This is really not a fault of the Fire's capabilities, but I definitely think the iPad would have been easier for him to learn to use.  I also wish we would have bought him the bigger screen. He has arthritis and so does not have fine motor skills. He is constantly accidentally rewinding his books when he wants to press the home button which is at the bottom of the screen where the bar is that tracks where you are in the book.  We bought the HDX 7 inch because when I had him use my mini and my husband's iPad; he liked the smaller size of the mini. My advice to anyone planning to purchase a tablet for an elderly person would be to get what you yourself are familiar with.

Reviews.Title: I recommend this highly to everyone for every need and want :)
Reviews.Author: Debbie "Let your smile change the world, not ...
Reviews.Content: I teach computers and tech to people with different needs and I haven't found anyone that this isn't the perfect answer :)  So far I have 4 clients and 3 family members I have "convinced" to get one.  I only wish I had one too :)  My turn will come soon I know it will :)  Maybe Amazon will give me a credit for all the Fires I help sell and I will buy one with that :)  So just incase let them know my review helped you decide :)  I am kidding :)  only about the credit.  I am very serious about how wonderful the Fire is and how useful it is for just about everything and everyone :)  Please ask questions before buying to make sure because you want to be so happy when the box arrives that it makes you so excited for at least a month or two :) :) :)

Reviews.Title: Totally recommend!
Reviews.Author: wcfbrat
Reviews.Content: I had the first generation kindle and loved it.  I chose this new kindle because of its weight and battery life expectancy and I have not been disappointed.  The visual display is so clear and the criticism of the blue tinge on the outskirts of the display screen is not noticeable and does not take away the reading pleasure.  Overall, I am totally satisfied with this product and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great updated Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Jean Farmer "gizzmogeek"
Reviews.Content: Replaced an original generation Kindle Fire with the new HDX Kindle Fire and it's awesome. Faster, brighter, better picture. Nothing to complain about. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Mayday!
Reviews.Author: Kris Cantu
Reviews.Content: For those of you that haven't had to use the new Mayday feature know that it is awesome.  I got my KF HDX today and had a couple account registration issues to sort out.  I went into the help feature and next thing I know their was real live person on a mini "skype" screen who walked me through what I needed to do.  She could even "highlight and circle" where I needed to go to do it.  Way cool!

Reviews.Title: Deal breaker issues
Reviews.Author: boomer
Reviews.Content: I've had two HDX 7s in a week, and they both exhibit three issues that I can't overlook.1) blue light bleeding - for me too distracting in web pages, reading, etc. I can't train myself to ignore it2) wifi - I have two access points in my house, and the Fire can't hold a signal. 90% of the time I have to turn my wifi off then on to rejoin my network3) battery drain in standby. Maybe related to wifi hunting, but leaving device in standby all day drains my battery from 100% to 40% in about 10 hrsI wanted to like this for the screen, simplicity, and Prime features, but in the end, I'll try the nexus or just default to the mini.

Reviews.Title: No HDMI mini Connection!
Reviews.Author: DaMann4u
Reviews.Content: Before I tell why I gave this three stars you most understand that this is my fourth kindle and my third kindle fire hd and my first kindle HDX so I have some history with Amazon kindle products. The reason why I moved to the HDX is because I needed I much bigger hard drive. My other kindle fires are 16 gb and they became to small very quickly when I started storing HD movies. A major draw back and disappointment for the HDX is that you cannot connect a hdmi mini cable to it and watch on a bigger television. No HDMI mini connection. That's a bummer!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!
Reviews.Author: S. E. Hochstetler
Reviews.Content: love, love, love my hdx. I have the kindle keyboard, i have the kindle fire and now i have the hdx. the grapics are great! it is faster, lighter. It has some great new features like mayday and mirror...

Reviews.Title: Disappointing when compared to past Kindle Fire's and the current crop of 7-inch Tablets
Reviews.Author: Ken Z. "kzVegas"
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers I'm a heavy tablet user and I can setup several tablets next to one another to compare strengths and weaknesses.  I have currently:1.) Kindle Fire (1st Gen.)2.) Kindle Fire HD 8.3 (2nd Gen.)3.) Kindle Fire HDX (3rd Gen Fire)4.) iPad Air  (5th Gen iPad)5.) iPad Mini with Retina Display (2nd Gen iPad Mini)6.) Google Nexus 7 (2013)7.) Nvidia Shield8.) ASUS Transformer TF-101First, let me say I think the Kindle Fire platform is really nice when compared to the straight-up Google android experience.  Amazon does a great job of bridging the technical gaps for a user wanting to use a tablet and not have to constantly enter their email and password.  The Amazon docs, photos, music and video compare better in use to Apple's iCloud experience and makes the Amazon prime a solid investment.  Additionally, the horsepower of the Kindle HDX is amazing and makes this tablet for the holiday 2013 season a solid gaming platform.  My own benchmarking of the Kindle Fire HDX shows that gaming performance and CPU performance place this unit within the same performance bracket as the current generation of iPads and the Nvidia sheild.  Which is saying something when the HDX is half the cost of an iPad mini and 2/3rds the cost of a Nvidia shield.My disappointment comes from the screen on the Kindle fire HDX.  The HDX's screen shows a very visible and noticeable blue ring around the display's edge.  I've measured the blue ring to be one-eighth of inch along the long edges of the screen and slightly less on the short edges of the screen.  These blue edges really become notable when you are reading a book or browsing a web page that have white page backgrounds.  The blue ringing is much less noticeable when viewing the carousel page (which are grey) or running a app that uses something darker around the edges.I can not recommend the Kindle Fire HDX to my friends, family and colleagues because of what I consider to be design defect in the screen.  This blue ring is not apparent on either my Kindle Fire or Kindle Fire HD 8.9 or other tablets that I have.

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet Ever!!!!
Reviews.Author: janell2012np
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new Kindle Fire HDX! It's the most amazing tablet ever. The mayday feature is a lifesaver. And you barely have to wait for someone to help you. The person is nice, but the better part is that they actually know what they are doing. I wouldn't trade my Kindle in the world! I always carry it with me!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Andrew V.
Reviews.Content: The only negative I've found after 4 days use is the inability to play Flash video.  Unfortunately Adobe no longer offers Flash Player for Android.

Reviews.Title: Fun Find
Reviews.Author: Barbara Kidd
Reviews.Content: Screen image is fantastic.  It is so much more fun and useful than a plain ole reader which is what I was using - I can check E Mail, play a game, or read a book.  I have not yet mastered all of the other possibilities.  It does not require an extra internet service of its own - but does need access to Wi-Fi in order to use the E Mail and other interactive internet functions.  I still have a lot  to learn and master - but in the interim I am enjoying it immensely.  On the negative side - if you are playing games the battery life is not long - it requires charging often.  My other problem is in trying to leave the page you are reading in a book and go somewhere else and then come back to that page - I have lost where I actually was in the book when I did go back to reading same.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Nebraska Gal
Reviews.Content: I am absolutely in love with my Kindle. For several weeks I debated on what type of tablet to get and I for sure made the right choice. Love the apps and love how easy it is to get books. With the amazon Prime it is the greatest thing ever!!!

Reviews.Title: Nice 7 inch tablet
Reviews.Author: Obee "Ob"
Reviews.Content: I really like the HDX,,all the fuss about the blue around the edge of the screen is crazy.You really have to look for it on a pure white screen to even notice it.I really don't understand what people want for a 200$ tablet,,I have a full size Ipad and sure it works like silk and is perfect but it also cost me 599$.I love this small tablet,I take it everwhere with me.If you are looking for a small tablet with the fastest processor out there and one of the best displays,,BUY THISThis is an update for the HDX,,,used it now for almost a month and I still love it.I also own a Nexus 7 2013 and the HDX beats it hands down,,Stuff to know,,the nexus 7 is about an inch and a half longer making it feel very big compared to the kindle..reviewers complain about the kindle being difficult to use do not want to try the nexus,,there are no directions at all in the pack and there is no help to call like the kindle.I have them both in a I blason cover which I can say is a very nice cover for both of them for the price.Performance wise the kindle and the nexus are close,both have beautiful screens,,but I have to say that the kindle has better sound.To let you know I only bought the nexus so I can use the google play store,,but have to say I still love the kindle,,and I am  still trying to see the blue edges after a month of use.I either got a very good kindle because its barely there after looking really hard to see it

Reviews.Title: Addicted great knowledge resource
Reviews.Author: Debra M
Reviews.Content: This is the coolest thing ever. I'm hooked. Books, tv, movies, games, e-mail and more. Awesome picture quality, sharp clean view.

Reviews.Title: GREAT KINDLE!
Reviews.Author: WIGirl
Reviews.Content: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE MY KINDLE!!! I have had it for about a week and I really LOVE it so far! Great Picture, Sound and has my email and everything right there when I open it! Awesome price too!

Reviews.Title: Review of new Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: davy gurley
Reviews.Content: Had older style Kindle Fire which I liked but some great reviews for the new HDX made me want to replace it--received it and getting used to new abilities it is able to do. Color and brightness are outstanding. Having the live help is great!!!--had to use it within an hour of set up and in 30 seconds my Genie in the box gave me the info and help I required.  Awesome!!

Reviews.Title: This is the tablet/ereader to get!
Reviews.Author: Chad Homme
Reviews.Content: My wife has had a Kindle for a while and I decided to get one.  This is nothing short of incredible.  Screen clarity is amazing, battery life is great.  Couldn't ask for a better reader/tablet.

Reviews.Title: It just gets better and better!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've had every single Kindle Fire, but this new HDX is, hands down, one of the most innovative tablets ever. The two best features are the Mayday button and the song lyrics. No tablet that I'm aware of has any support even close to the Mayday button. You simply tap the onscreen button and, voila, a person comes on your screen and helps you. A real person you can see. The can't see you, but they can see your screen. I've used it a couple of times and never waited more than 10-15 seconds before they were right there speaking to me. AMAZING!Second, the new rolling lyrics with your music is awesome, however,  not many songs have the lyrics yet. I'm sure they're working on the data base, but the more current songs are available. On some albums some songs are done but not all. Great idea and hopefully Amazon is bringing lyrics in quickly.And let's not forget xray for movies. Tap the screen and you'll get a pop-up with movie info like the names of which actors are on the screen at any given moment. Awesome!Awesome machine... If it just had front AND rear facing cameras it would be perfect. It does have front facing, but not rear. Try it you'll love it! I hope the Mayday button catches on across the industry because support is usually so difficult! Way to go Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Really good buy!
Reviews.Author: Marwan
Reviews.Content: I wanted a 7" tablet, but I was not sure if I buy the Nexus 7 or the Kindle fire HDX. Eventually I went and bought this device and I am really happy and satisfied. It can do pretty much everything you need!! You can download missing apps from outside sources, so it is not a big deal. Its performance really great and I have never been disappointed so far, the only problem I noticed that this device missing a navigation apps and Google maps doesn't work as expected on it! Beside this issue, the Kindle fire HDX is flawless!

Reviews.Title: Simply AWESOME display. Super THIN. WOW!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: William Mutschler "Copper Moose"
Reviews.Content: I debated heavily over this, putting it on my one and only thing for Christmas. I wanted to see the performance and size of this, including thin-ness. The color and clarity are simply stunningly fantastic -- better than any other tablet that I've seen. The FAA discount day enabled me to get it at 15% off, enabling me to afford the 64 GB  (my other spec wish-feature), even though I had to use my debit card because…….the day before. I had bought a reconditioned 8.9" Kindle HD, with 32 gb the day before with Amazon Card, but haven't opened it, knowing that this would be here a day later.My kids have filled their Kindles with game crap, but I wanted the extra space to have more books downloaded at the same time, and more space for movies, music and 'future expansion space.'One might laugh, but as a comics fan I read the volume collections. A little small for my old eyes, so I'm sort of forced to use panel view. But, for USA Today, the smallest text size was just perfect. That is an auto format site, and works great.Finally, my OWN Kindle. I had been sharing one used by my son, but now, no more swapping. No drained battery for dear old dad.I don't see a speed difference yet (I'm not a gamer), but this thing is THIN. I'm hoping to get longer battery life with a smaller screen.The only thing so far is that I am adjusting to a smaller Kindle, having been using the 8.9 HD.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX Wow, Very Nice Indeed
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Love it. Buttons are much better than last iteration and can be found by feel easily. Sound, like KFHD, is great. The display is awesome and the difference in speed is remarkable. I have had all three generations of Kindle Fire and will most likely keep buying as they continue to improve. BUT, I have been happy with each one.  Just as Apple lovers say you couldn't give them a Kindle Fire, you couldn't give me an iPad. Both are great products but appeal to different people. I did keep my original Kindle Paperwhite rather than upgrading but may jump on the next one depending on the specs. I think the idea of the May Day button is great but I haven't used it. Since I'm on my third Fire I've just not run into anything I need help with yet. If I do need help I'll be glad it's there. Everyone's experience is never the same so I feel for those who have had problems. But this I know, Amazon will make it right.

Reviews.Title: Good Enough
Reviews.Author: Fred Dempster "FAD"
Reviews.Content: Really like the new FIRE HDX 32GB. Good enough means I would expect to pay a lot more for perfect. Yes there is a bit of blue if you push the video, do not see on movies, and I use my Kindle PW for reading. The new origami case is cool, used last night watching a movie as I handed out Halloween candy. Still learning some of the less used features as I go.

Reviews.Title: My Favorite Kindle to Date
Reviews.Author: M. Woodward "Mark S. Woodward"
Reviews.Content: This new Kindle Fire XDS is my favorite Kindle to date. Every feature (weight, dimensions, high definition-screen, camera, WIFI, power button location, processor, internet capabilities, and software) are leading-edge. I ordered the smaller size reader/tablet because I like the paperback book feel that it enjoys - easy to handle and hold whether I am sitting in chair, in bed, or on airplane.

Reviews.Title: Really Nice But, Not Without Compromise!
Reviews.Author: Perry
Reviews.Content: I bought the Fire HDX after seeing Apple raise the price of their iPad Mini by $70 if I wanted the Retina Display model.PERFORMANCEThe hardware is top notch in that it is a very solid build and seems to run almost flawlessly every day!The power of the CPU/GPU are honestly impressive and make for a very nice performance bump over previous generations of the Fire as well as other tablets. I honestly think the iPad Mini Retina and the Fire HDX are in a performance class all of their own!DISPLAYThe screen is super sharp and has incredible contrast all around, color accuracy is very high but, the backlight does have a soft blue glow around the edges.Now a note from my Eye Doctor, Increased intake of blue light into our eyes has raised the percentage of people who have degenerative disorders with their eyes and they recommend Yellow Filtered Lenses to protect your eyes.  Research Macular Degeneration and Blue Light to see for yourself and keep in mind, this is not exclusive to the Fire HDX but, their decision to use Blue Lighting makes it worth mentioning (this has always been an issue but, mobile devices and increased use of computers make it a much larger issue).SOFTWAREThe interface of the software only has one feature that bugs the check out of me and that's the Carousel, everything else with the OS and apps actually works very well and I'm pretty impressed with what I'm seeing! Oh and Silk works great if you stop it from accelerating page loading because, it crashes often with that on.Mayday is also a pleasant surprise and I've used it a few times for some quick answers. It was way easier than googling the answers and even my Apple friends were really impressed with it.Another issue was that Amazon noted that you could now download Prime Videos to watch on the go but, they neglected to mention that it is only a small selection of movies that can be downloaded so you're forced to stream them and that creates larger issues with Battery Life (see the Battery Section).Not having a YouTube App underscores a larger issue with the Fire line...  The App Store is severely lacking and many apps don't run right on the new tablets (Dead Trigger is upside down) and side loading apps often leaves you with apps that either don't work or don't work correctly 100% of the time!  This is a real issue and you would think that Amazon would want to stress the importance of getting these apps to work right out of the box!The Interface also has support for posting to Facebook and Twitter but, no Google+ and I'm not sure why Amazon is so intent on being Anti Google with their devices.BATTERY LIFEBattery is decent for every day tasks like Facebook, web browsing, emailing, reading books, playing a few games, and watching an occasional video clip.However, streaming movies from Prime resulted in a Net Battery Life of 5 Hours and that's half what Amazon claimed!OVERALLNo YouTube and using a blue back light has left me rating the Fire as average and I honestly think Amazon might have made a mistake with this screens back lighting. Everything else about the tablet is spot on and well worth the money they charge for it.For the record, even though I consider it an average offering, it is the best deal for the money and sadly, the other offerings might actually be worse than the Fire (the Nexus 7 FHD certainly is far less stable as is the iOS 7 based iPad line).Okay, two more notes that happened to me today...1st, the Tablet randomly decided to reboot itself while I was reading an ebook and that's twice it has done this in the kindle App.2nd, While I was tethering the device just decided it was going to download a very large firmware update without telling me it was doing it and needless to say, before I realized it my monthly data allowance was done!  I guess the only consolation here is that it might have actually fixed the first issue!--------------------------------------------------------------------------------Update 11/25/13The latest patch from Amazon appears to have remedied the lockup issue and I'm very pleased with it.Since the locks were happening however, I purchased an iPad Mini Retina and honestly, I find the fire HDX to be more responsive and fluid overall and the display is noticeably more vibrant on the Fire HDX.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Krista  Timm
Reviews.Content: I have a first kindle fire they released and I loved it but now I love this one more. It's much lighter. I loved that it came with a Kindle fast charger as the first edition didn't.

Reviews.Title: Great improvement over original Fire with some issues
Reviews.Author: Elliot Markovitz
Reviews.Content: Got my HDX today.  I'm not going to repeat all of the great commentary already provided by others.  I do want to offer some "heads up" advice since there is no accompanying documentation.After turning it on for the first time I noted all of my books, apps, etc. appeared.  However, none would work.  I figured I'd go to Mayday.  Surprise: no Mayday button.  I spent about 1/2 hour on Amazon Help chat (PLEASE MOVE YOUR CALL CENTERS BACK TO THE USA!) I finally learned that you need to run a software update before trying to do most anything.  Did that and all is well.Second issue:  I had purchased a Marware Origin cover.  The Kindle has to be upside down to properly fit.  Not sure if you can change the screen rotation.  That will be a Mayday contact later.

Reviews.Title: Love it Already and just received it today!
Reviews.Author: Anniemac
Reviews.Content: Just got my new Kindle HDX and everything is setting up well. Haven't needed help or support yet. This is easy to use and syncs with all my apps easily. It's simpler than I thought it would be. Now I can't wait to get a nice case to keep it safe and some clear anti-glare screen covers. This is the even better than my smart phone and I think it's smarter!

Reviews.Title: Great improvement!
Reviews.Author: mannaalso
Reviews.Content: .Many months ago , I ordered an earlier Kindle but was not happy with it compared to my Apple iPadThis kindle is much better in my opinion -- lighter in the hand ,better screen resolution and sound--- in fact , a very nice device."I never leave home without it !! ".  Manna

Reviews.Title: Mixed Blessing
Reviews.Author: Christine Root
Reviews.Content: Bought my Kindle Fire HDX 7" after enjoying my Kindle paperwhite for over a year. I thought that the Kindle Fire HDX would solve the problem of connecting without WiFi. Wrong. I also thought he camera would be usy to use. Wrong. I was excited that a MAYDAY button would be there to help me. Wrong. No WiFi =s no MayDay help. The color and quality of the print on the kindle FireHDX is excellent. BUT even after buying a book from Amazon on using the Kindle Fire HDX,I am still having trouble. It is hard and slow to connect to WiFI unlike my other Kindle. It is more confusing to use . No manual. Harder to get back to "tablet top" and not clear why my Amazon account shows 20 plus dictionaries in multiple languages are on my Kindle Fire HDX without my requesting them Nor is their an option to delete them under my manage my Kindle account as there is with other books that I have borrowed from the Public Library. Sadly,i was issued an IPAD MINI through work after I bought my Kinde Fire HDX. I have found the IPAD MINI easier to use esp.in terms of the camera function.

Reviews.Title: What were you thinking Amazon?!?!? 2 deal killers.
Reviews.Author: J.Brown
Reviews.Content: I have a Kindle Fire HD and love it.  So when I heard about the new HDX, I was chomping at the bit to purchase one.  But there are TWO deal killers.  In this day and age, a table ought to have a Micro SD memory card slot for expansion, and an HDMI connector - ESPECIALLY a media tablet like these!  The new HDX series has NEITHER.  The original Fire did not have a MicroSD slot either, and I was hoping Amazon would add one, but they did not.  Then they took away the HDMI port which I use often to play a movies on my TV.  They added wireless streaming (via Miracast) which my TV (new within the last 6 months) does not have.  Without that port, the HDX cannot stream to my TV and makes it nearly useless for me - certainly it will NOT be something a I spend $$ on.  Checking the accessory list, they don't even offer a wireless Miracast to HDMI receiver!  Talk about shooting themselves in the foot!  Maybe the next round Amazon... maybe...
